title: Gymnastics Instructor
description:
Life’s too short to not work someplace awesome! If you love kids, enjoy moving, and being active in your job while having a ton of fun, you may be the person we are looking for!  

  

**What we expect from you…**  

* Introduce kids to the serious fun of education and play, all within The Little Gym's unique learning environment.
* Teach amazing classes based on our proven curriculum and teaching method (don’t worry, we’ll teach you how!)
* Provide outstanding customer service and membership experience. We treat our members like family here.
* Lead/Assist gymnastics classes for children aged 4 months to 12 years, ensuring lesson plans are carefully followed
* Work with children accommodating various ability levels, promoting skill advancement, self-confidence, and enjoyment of the sport.
* Evaluate and track students' progress, offer tailored feedback, and adjust instruction to meet individual needs.
* Foster a supportive, energetic, and positive class atmosphere that encourages student involvement and a love for gymnastics.
* Adhere to safety protocols and best practices, including correct equipment use and spotting techniques, to ensure student safety.
* Engage in staff meetings, training sessions, and professional development opportunities to refine teaching skills and stay current with gymnastics trends.
* Support gym events, competitions, and showcases, offering guidance and encouragement to students.
* Maintain the cleanliness and organization of the gymnastics area and equipment.
* **Note:** Singing, tumbling, cheering, dancing, jumping, wiggling, skipping, smiling and laughing are vital to the role! Please be able and prepared to do all of the above- every day in every class! The "Vibe" is EVERYTHING!

**A few little requirements…**  

* Reliable transportation to get to/from work (Location of Gym: Englewood, NJ)
* Strong time management skills (classes run on a tight schedule)
* Communication is key! Both with the Directors/Owners and the students/parents
* Ability to work evenings and weekends (not always, and we can discuss further during the interview process)
* Preferred: Background in children's education, gymnastics, cheerleading, etc.
* Ability to sing, tumble, cheer, dance, high-five, smile, laugh and more!
* I cannot stress this enough.... you MUST love working with children! If you don't, then this isn't the right place for you (and that's ok!)

**You’d fit in here if…**  

* Teach amazing classes based on our proven curriculum and teaching method (don’t worry, we’ll teach you how!)
* Provide outstanding customer service and membership experience. We treat our members like family here.
* Create a warm, fun, and educational environment for the Children in each class.
* Treat each class and each child as if it’s their first day – EVERY WEEK!
* You love having fun, like giving high 5’s, and can play like a child! (A background in child development, physical education, and/or gymnastics helps as well)
* You live to serve! Making others feel good makes you feel good.
* Kids really like you, but their parents really like you too.
* You were voted most likely to be in a good mood by your high school classmates.
* You love to have fun, but you know when to buckle down and do work.

**You may think we’re awesome because…**  

* Children walk out of our classes more confident than when they walked in every single day.
* You’ll get your steps in and close your activity rings while you work because you’ll be moving all day.
* We take our fun pretty seriously but also take the role we play in our community and with each child we meet seriously. The relationships you’ll build here will last a lifetime.
* You could get paid to fold t-shirts or you could get paid to act like a dinosaur. The choice is yours.
* This may not be your career, but we are surely going to train you like it is.

**But seriously read the fine print…**  

With more than 300 locations across the globe, The Little Gym is the world’s premier enrichment and physical development center for kids 4 months through 12 years. For over four decades, The Little Gym has helped millions of kids experience the thrill of achievement, develop new skills, and find new confidence through a variety of gymnastics-based programs. Parent/Child, Pre-K, and Grade School classes are all taught in a clean, fun, safe, and nurturing environment, which encourages children to develop at their own pace.  

  

As a part of The Little Gym team, you will be part of a family dedicated to the growth and development of children all over the globe. If this sounds like the job you’ve been dreaming about, what are you waiting for? We’ve been waiting for you!  

All associated locations are independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchise, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of that franchise. All inquiries about employment at this franchise should be made directly to the franchisee, and not to The Little Gym Franchising Corporate.

title: Interior Design Assistant
description:
**About Us:**

Tirmizi Design Studio is a leading interior design firm specializing in creating stylish, functional, and personalized spaces for high-end residential and commercial clients. We are known for our attention to detail, creative solutions, and commitment to delivering exceptional results. Our team is passionate about design and dedicated to bringing our clients' visions to life.

**Job Description:**

We are seeking a motivated and creative Interior Design Assistant to join our dynamic team. As an Interior Design Assistant, you will support our lead designers in various aspects of the design process, from initial concept development to project completion. This is an excellent opportunity for someone who is passionate about interior design and looking to grow their career in a collaborative and inspiring environment.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Assist lead designers in developing design concepts, mood boards, and presentations.
* Collaborate with clients to understand their design preferences, lifestyle, and budget.
* Source and select materials, furnishings, and accessories in line with project requirements.
* Prepare and maintain project documentation, including design plans, schedules, and budgets.
* Coordinate with vendors, contractors, and suppliers to ensure timely delivery and installation of materials and furnishings.
* Manage projects from concept to completion, ensuring that all elements of the project meet the highest standards of quality and attention to detail.
* Conduct site visits and assist in the implementation of design plans, including furniture placement and styling.
* Maintain the design library and manage sample inventory.
* Communicate effectively with clients to understand their needs and preferences, ensuring a seamless and positive experience.
* Maintain a contract or agreement with clients to ensure that all parties are in compliance with the project's scope and budget.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest design trends and technologies, including lighting sales and building codes.
* Utilize software such as MS Office, Google Suite, AutoCAD, SketchUp, and Adobe Creative Suite products (such as Acrobat Professional, Photoshop, InDesign) to manage project documents and visual materials.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Interior Design or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in interior design.
* Strong experience with design software and project management.
* Strong understanding of design principles and materials, previous experience in interior design is preferred.
* Strong creative and artistic skills with a keen eye for detail.
* Proficiency in communications software such as Google Suite, MS Office, and Slack.
* Proficiency in design software such as AutoCAD, SketchUp, and Adobe Creative Suite.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills with proven track record of successfully managing projects from start to finish.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with clients and contractors.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Familiarity with building codes and regulations.
* A passion for design and a willingness to learn and grow within the industry.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary and opportunities for professional growth.
* A collaborative and supportive work environment.
* Opportunities to work on diverse and exciting projects.
* Employee discounts on design services and products.
* Health and wellness benefits (if applicable).

**How to Apply:**

Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume, portfolio, and a brief cover letter outlining their qualifications and design philosophy to this job posting.

**Application Deadline:**

There is no application deadline. We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Tirmizi Design Studio is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in the workplace. We encourage all qualified individuals to apply.

Job Types: Contract, Part-time, Temporary, Internship

Pay: $18.00 - $24.00 per hour

Expected hours: 16 – 24 per week

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* No nights
* No weekends
* On call

Experience:

* Interior design: 3 years (Required)
* AutoCAD: 3 years (Required)

* New York, NY 10007 (Required)

description:
Here at Scotts Miracle-Gro there is no such thing as a typical day. Our culture is constantly energized by new and exciting growth opportunities and at a rapid pace. Below are details on an open job. If the role interests you and you would like to be considered we encourage you to apply!!

Seasonal Merchandisers report directly to a Sales Manager and work within our big box retailers, such as Home Depot and Lowe's. As part of the day-to-day responsibilities Merchandisers execute merchandising directives and re-sets, establish a positive rapport with store personnel and customers, and relay information to Scotts Sales team regarding inventory opportunities.
In this role you will:* Merchandise products inside and outside stores
* Provide customers and store associates with product knowledge on Scotts brands
* Ensure product is stocked and presentable at all times

What you’ll need to be successful:* Experience in retail, merchandising and/or stocking preferred
* Problem solving and service oriented attitude
* Ability to work a flexible schedule, including holidays and weekends
* Ability to operate company provided technology
* Current, valid driver's license and reliable transportation
* Ability to routinely walk, stand, climb an 8-12 foot ladder, lift up to 45 lbs and be exposed to weather elements (e.g. heat, cold, wind, rain)


What we do for our Merchandisers:* Offer a retirement program with up to 7.5% 401(k) match
* Compensation for commuting expenses

* Provide valuable, hands-on experience within merchandising, retail and customer service

title: Accounts Payable / Accounts Receivable Accountant
description:
**Job Title: Accounts Payable / Accounts Receivable Accountant**

**Location:** Norwalk, Connecticut

**Job Type:** Full-Time

**Salary range**: $60,000 and $70,000

**Reports To:** Assistant Controller

**Company Overview:** **About Van Dyk Recycling Solutions:**

Van Dyk Recycling Solutions is a leading provider of equipment and solutions for the recycling industry. With a strong emphasis on innovation and sustainability, Van Dyk offers a comprehensive range of machinery and services tailored to meet the diverse needs of its clients worldwide.

As a global leader in recycling technology, Van Dyk provides equipment for sorting, processing, and handling various recyclable materials such as paper, plastics, metals, and more. The company's solutions encompass everything from single machines to complete turnkey systems, designed to maximize efficiency and throughput while minimizing environmental impact.

Van Dyk's commitment to excellence extends beyond its products to its dedicated service division, which offers maintenance, repairs, and technical support to ensure the continued performance and reliability of its equipment.

**Job Summary:** The Accounts Payable/Accounts Receivable Accountant is responsible for the company's accounts payable and receivable functions. This role ensures accurate and timely processing of invoices, payments, and collections, and maintains effective financial controls. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and a solid understanding of accounting principles.

**Key Responsibilities:**

*Accounts Payable:*

* Process and review invoices for accuracy, ensuring they comply with company policies.
* Prepare and execute payments via checks, ACH transfers, or other methods.
* Reconcile account, bank and vendor statements and resolve discrepancies.
* Maintain accurate records of accounts payable transactions and documentation.
* Assist in month-end and year-end closing processes by providing necessary reports and documentation
* Knowledge of foreign exchange procedures

*Accounts Receivable:*

* Generate and send invoices to customers in a timely manner.
* Monitor and follow up on outstanding receivables to ensure timely payment.
* Reconcile customer accounts and resolve payment discrepancies.
* Create and resolve service and parts invoices
* Process customer payments and apply them to appropriate accounts.
* Maintain accurate records of accounts receivable transactions.

*General Responsibilities:*

* Assist with financial audits and prepare supporting documentation as needed.
* Collaborate with other departments to address financial inquiries and resolve issues.
* Prepare financial reports and summaries related to accounts payable and receivable.
* Identify and implement process improvements to enhance efficiency and accuracy.
* Ensure compliance with accounting policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field with at least 5 years of experience preferred
* Proven experience as an Accounts Payable/Receivable Accountant or in a similar financial role.
* Proficient in accounting software and Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word).
* Strong understanding of accounting principles and practices.
* Excellent organizational and time-management skills.
* Attention to detail and accuracy.
* Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to handle sensitive and confidential information.

**Preferred Skills:**

* Experience with Acumatica would be preferred, but not required.
* Knowledge of industry-specific regulations or requirements.
* Basic knowledge of tax regulations related to accounts payable and receivable.

**Working Conditions:**

* Office environment.
* Regular business hours, with occasional overtime as needed.

**Benefits:**

* Salaried position with 20 paid vacation days and 8 paid holidays.
* Paid health and dental insurance for you, your spouse, and dependent children with a premium paid for $100,000.00 life insurance policy.
* Profit-sharing pension plan as well as an additional 401K plan offer.
* A varied and challenging position with a high degree of independence within an internationally active organization with strong growth ambitions. Plenty of opportunities for personal development**.**

**Application Instructions:** To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your qualifications and experience to achirca@vdrs.com.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Accounting: 5 years (Required)
* Microsoft Office: 3 years (Required)
* Microsoft Word: 3 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Norwalk, CT 06854 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Security Assistant Manager (MGM Yonkers)
description:
**Pay Range:**


The typical pay range for this role is:

*Minimum - Maximum*

$59,280.00 - $94,848.00
Please keep in mind that this range represents the pay range for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual salary offer will take into account a wide range of factors, including location.

**THE JOB:**


The Security Assistant Manager will oversee and manage the security operation and team members assigned to them by ensuring the operation is staffed efficiently, that employees perform to established expectations, and by ensuring the protection of personnel, property, and assets. This role requires strong leadership, problem-solving skills, and the ability to respond effectively to various security situations.

**THE DAY-TO-DAY:**

* Manage security officers, department operations, and support staff, to include interviewing, hiring, creating employee schedules, implementing approved procedures, training and evaluating officers, enforcing policy and administering discipline and coaching as needed; plan, develop and direct staff, work assignments and station coverage
* Oversee guest and employee safety by promoting a safe and secure environment and implementing and enforcing state, local jurisdiction, regulatory, and company policies and procedures
* Act as a liaison with the appropriate outside agencies during security incidents
* Assist management with onsite investigations; coordinate and supervise onsite investigations as deemed necessary
* Monitor and support security-related processing
* Ensure guest questions and concerns are addressed immediately, either personally, or by contacting the appropriate department or member of management, to obtain the answer to the question, or obtain assistance in resolving the concern
* Respond to guest and employee emergencies and reported threats, document incidents and ensure proper escalation for reporting and resolution purposes

**THE IDEAL CANDIDATE:**

* Proven experience in a security management role, with at least 2 years of experience in a supervisory leadership position in a high-end resort, casino environment, or law enforcement and/or military setting
* Able to effectively communicate in English, in both verbal and written forms
* Strong knowledge of verbal and written investigative reporting
* Excellent leadership, communication, guest service, and interpersonal skills
* Ability to handle stressful situations with professionalism and tact
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and security management software

**THE PERKS & BENEFITS:**

* Competitive salary and benefits package

title: Water Utility Technician
description:
The Township of East Brunswick is accepting applications for a full-time Water Utility Technician within the Department of Water & Sewer. Under the supervision of the Water Maintenance Coordinator, this role will oversee the overall operation of the distribution network and the equipment required for preforming a wide variety of underground pipeline system constriction, repairs, and distributed potable water to the consumer. Repair and maintenance of water infrastructure includes but not limited to mains, valves, service lines, hydrants, sewer mains, sewer laterals, and sewer pump stations. Responsibilities also include maintaining machinery, tools, materials, and other supplies; writing reports of completed work; observing and making field investigations of new main or tap orders; checking pressure, chlorination, and bacteriological samplings; and additional duties as assigned. **This position requires responding to emergencies outside of normal working hours.**

**Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities**: Must be able to understand the Township’s water distribution network, policies & procedures, as well as state and federal regulations application to the areas but not limited to SDWA, PEOSH, and Right to Know; use and have proper operation of common hand and power tools, equipment, materials, and methods used in water installation; acquire knowledge of installing, inspecting, maintaining, and repairing a variety of underground pipelines and related facilities; read, write, speak, understand, and communicate in English.

**Experience & Education**: Entry level. High school diploma and/or equivalent required. Supplemental courses in water are a plus.

**Licensing & Certification**: Valid NJ driver’s license; CDL Class B license with air brake and tankers endorsement; NJ State licenses for water and/or sewer is preferred.

All applications must be submitted by **September 11th, 2024**.

The Township reserves the right to hire prior to the closing of the submission of applications.

title: Event Services Supervisor
description:
*Convene is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and we believe that diverse teams are the best teams. We live our values of GRIT (Genuine, Relentless, Integrity & Teamwork) and strive to create an inclusive and equitable workplace where everyone can be their true selves, where we all show up for each other. In line with our goal to be 1% better every day, we are committed to listening, learning, growing and improving. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to join us on this journey.* 

Convene, a global industry leader in premium meeting, event, flexible office, and membership spaces is seeking a Service Supervisor who will assist in leading the Hospitality Service Team at one of our New York City properties. As a Service Supervisor, you will be responsible for ensuring the success of all programs while maintaining a high-quality products and service levels. The Service Supervisor will report directly to the Service Manager and the General Manager

**What You’ll Do:**

* Supervise and participate in the setup, execution, and breakdown of all programming quickly and efficiently and ensure that it is following the Program Execution Order
* Supervise the service team and support staff including setup, utilities, maintenance, and security
* Coordinate culinary service between the culinary team and service team
* Monitor inventory and keep culinary informed of accurate counts
* Enforce all rules and regulations and ability to carry out all safety and emergency programs
* Follow health and safety regulations and ensure sanitation and cleanliness of service areas
* Be involved in and/or conduct ongoing training of service specialists to maintain standards of service
* Manage opening and/or closing inspection duties
* Maintain service cleanliness in front and back of the sit
* Ensure positive overall client satisfaction
* Ability to interact with guests and/or associates in a courteous, empathetic, and discreet manner
* Adhere to basic hygiene procedures and grooming standards
* Lead and perform duties of service technician during shift

**What We Look For:** 

* Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Hospitality or related field preferred
* Minimum 2 years’ of progressive experience in a conference center or a related field
* Previous supervisory responsibility preferred
* Strong knowledge of service standards, and different service types
* Knowledge of food and beverage preparation techniques, health department rules and regulations, liquor laws and regulations
* Ability to move, lift, carry, push, pull and place objects up to 25 pounds without assistance
* Ability to reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping

**Compensation:** 

The above job definition information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. Job duties and responsibilities are subject to change based on changing business needs and conditions.

: $25/hr with overtime eligibility

This role is also eligible for Convene's annual incentive performance bonus plan.

This information reflects the anticipated base salary range for this position based on current national data. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. Individual pay is based on skills, experience and other relevant factors.

**Who We Are:**

Convene is a global lifestyle hospitality company that designs and operates premium meeting, event, and flexible office spaces. It is the largest single provider of dedicated meeting and event venues in North America and the UK with a network of 39 locations across nine cities; Convene’s portfolio of brands includes etc.venues, Club 75, and the “by Convene” label for bespoke locations in partnership with other organizations. With a combined 44 years of experience, Convene brands bring hospitality and lifestyle into traditional commercial real estate assets, partnering with the industry’s top landlords to deliver increased building value while also creating premium experiences for tenants. The company counts Ares, RXR Realty, and Hudson’s Bay Company among its investors, and has been named one of America’s 100 Most Promising Companies by *Forbes* and a Best Workplace by *Inc.* magazine, *Fortune* magazine, and *Built In*. Learn more at https://convene.com/.

**We’re Here For You:**

At Convene, you’ll receive:

* Excellent health coverage for you and your family starting day one
* Medical and insurance navigation support through Eden Health
* Flexible vacation time plus time off for your birthday
* A Holiday closure each year to allow all employees to unplug and recharge
* 401K plan with company matching
* Professional development support
* A chance to be part of a dynamic, growing team
* The opportunity to have a significant impact on your team and the business in the work that you do
* A culture of GRIT (Genuine, Relentless, Integrity and Teamwork)

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $25.00 per hour

Work Location: In person

title: Telehealth Mental Health Counselors
description:
Nassau Psychology PC is a vibrant, established, well-run, group psychotherapy practice in Nassau County. We're looking for a licensed Clinical Psychologist, Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), Licensed Master Social Worker (LMSW), or Licensed Marriage Family Therapist (LMFT), Mental Health Counselor (MHC-LP) to join our team Remote or In Office!

We offer healing, hope and possibilities for adults, adolescents, children and couples through psychotherapy and psychoeducation that recognize the value, strengths, and resources of all we serve. We are seeking experienced mental health providers who demonstrate the heart and skills needed to help our valued clients and who want to be a part of a flourishing team. Nassau Psychology helps therapists focus on therapy by taking care of the business side of a clinical practice.

We provide supervision, referrals, marketing, full billing and scheduling services, administrative support, beautifully furnished office suites and a fun and cohesive team of therapists. The Position is fee for service with reimbursement for any late cancellations and no shows. *This opportunity is ideal for the highly skilled therapist who would like to work in a thriving group practice setting while enjoying a full-spectrum compensation package including competitive pay, medical, dental & vision benefits , 401k matching, paid sick leave, professional development funds - - without the work, headaches, or financial investment of running a business.*

As a group, we strive to provide psychotherapy that deepens our clients understanding of themselves and their relationships. To that end, we use psychodynamic, gestalt, and family systems theories to deepen our work. At the same time, we strive to provide quick symptom relief, integrating the use of CBT, mindfulness and other practices in our work as well. We regularly consult with each other on cases and benefit from different perspectives. There are opportunities for peer-consultation, case conference and didactics as well.

**We are currently seeking full-time and part-time licensed therapists for our Wantagh, Cedarhurst, Rockville Center, and Remote locations.**

Part Time 16+ client hours per week including 4 evenings, or 3 evenings and Sunday for those who wish to work on Sunday.

We are looking for therapists who can see diverse client populations and presenting issues. Experience working with couples is a plus, as well as experience working with children, but not a requirement. Ideal candidates possess the ability to conceptualize a case, understand underlying motivation and use a treatment model to drive treatment.

**Benefits for Licensed Therapists:**

* Bi-monthly automatic bank deposits based on all sessions provided during the previous 2 weeks - (no need to wait for protracted insurance reimbursement)
* All credentialing with insurance companies is done by the practice
* All new patients are on boarded by our New Patient Coordinators (all paperwork, forms etc. are completed by our staff) so you can focus on doing therapy
* We have a very steady referral stream of clients to easily fill your caseload
* All billing of insurance is handled on your behalf
* Feel at ease in well-appointed therapy rooms
* Weekly consultation group
* Opportunities to offer supervision
* Dedicated clinical support and group consultations
* Thriving and connected professional team with year-round social events, sharing each other's successes and milestones and professional growth opportunities

**Minimum Requirements for Licensed Therapists:**

* Master's degree and independent professional license in New York State (including Licensed Mental Health Counselor, Licensed Clinical Social Worker and Licensed Clinical Psychologist).
* Availability for afternoon / evening work is helpful. Weekend availability is a plus. Part-time or full-time work available.
* Currently, we are not considering applicants who are an Associate or Provisional level of license.
* Enrollment on insurance panels is welcomed, but not required.

**For more information about our practice, you can visit our website:**

www.nassaupsychology.org

To apply, please forward a cover letter of interest and resume to the email linked to this posting. You will then be emailed a list of questions - and your responses will help us determine the next steps in our process.

Nassau Psychology is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Pay: $40.00 - $50.00 per hour

title: Early Childhood Fitness Teacher
description:
Welcome to ECYC Child Development Center!

ECYC is a NAEYC accredited center with a great reputation for 40+ years. We provide quality care for children ranging from Infants to Kindergarten.

We are seeking a passionate and energetic **Fitness Teacher** to join our team. This role is crucial in helping our students from 1.5 years old to Kindergarten develop essential gross motor skills, sportsmanship, and a lifelong appreciation for health and fitness. The ideal candidate will be skilled in creating developmentally appropriate activities that cater to the diverse needs of young children.

**Shift:** 9:30am-12pm Monday-Friday

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Develop and Implement Age-Appropriate Curriculum:** Design and lead engaging activities that support gross motor skill development for younger children and more advanced sports and coordination exercises for older children.
* **Promote Health and Wellness:** Teach children about the importance of physical activity, nutrition, and overall wellness through fun and interactive lessons.
* **Encourage Physical Development:** Facilitate activities that enhance balance, coordination, strength, and flexibility in a safe and supportive environment.
* **Foster a Positive Learning Environment:** Create a nurturing and inclusive atmosphere where all children feel motivated to participate and enjoy their fitness journey.
* **Assess and Track Progress:** Observe and evaluate children’s development, providing feedback and adjustments to meet individual needs and ensure progress.
* **Engage with Parents and Staff:** Communicate effectively with parents and collaborate with other staff members to support each child’s growth and development.

**To be qualified for this position you'll need:**

* **Education:**
* Minimum: experience working with children varying in ages, in a childcare setting; understanding and appreciation for fitness; some credits toward physical education or similar field.
* Preferred: Associate's Degree in physical education or exercise science
* **Experience:** Demonstrated experience working with young children, preferably in a teaching or coaching role.
* **Knowledge:** Strong understanding of developmentally appropriate practices and principles for children ages 1.5 to Kindergarten.
* **Skills:** Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and motivate children of varying ages and abilities.
* **Certifications:** First Aid and CPR certification preferred. Additional certifications related to fitness or child development are a plus.
* **Passion:** A genuine enthusiasm for health, fitness, and child development, with a commitment to promoting a positive and active lifestyle.

**Here's what our current employees have to say about ECYC:**

"Love this center! I have grown so much as a teacher and have learned so much from my coordinator and administration. They aren’t just focused on developing the children, but also the staff. They listen to, care and support the teachers, which is a breath of fresh air compared to other places I’ve worked. Great place!" - ECYC Employee

"The team genuinely cares about the growth of the staff and their management of the workload. I don't know any other workplace that hosts a monthly "Dine and Unwind" event that offers a safe space for teachers to express their challenges. We have bi-weekly program meetings and monthly class meetings to discuss curriculum, goal setting, and children's progress. There are monthly staff events to foster team building. Credit to everyone trying to make it work during challenging times in the field of Early Childhood!" - ECYC Employee

Does this sound like the right fit for you? Apply today! We look forward to meeting you.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $17.00 - $22.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 12 per week

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* No weekends

Application Question(s):

* Are you 18 years of age or older?

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Certified and Registered Pharmacy Technician (PTCB or equivalent)
description:
Company Description

PersonalRX, a rapidly growing mail order pharmacy is looking to hire **pharmacy technicians** who have a CPhT (Required) and a NJ technician license (Required). This technician is needed to assist our personal care team as we are adding many new patients every day.

We offer a very competitive salary, annual bonus and ownership (company stock) in our company for high performers as well as promotional opportunities over time.

You do not have to stand and wait on customers all day long and your job responsibilities are varied depending on your experience. Our customers love us because of unique “patient concierge” business model. Check us out at either www.personalrx.com or view our YouTube testimonials (go to YouTube and search for PersonalRX).

We recently raised significant capital and looking to grow in our business by investing in our pharmacy systems and hiring well qualified technicians

Be part of this exciting opportunity and apply now. Someone from our executive team will call you back.

* CPhT **required**
* NJ State license **required**
* Computer experience **required**

**Job Description**

**Certified Patient Care Technician**

* Contact assigned patients at least once/month to review current medications and to determine if there are any changes
* Contact patient's doctors for new or changed prescriptions or if a renewal prescription is needed
* Process a Prior Authorization request, if needed, and enter required information into the system once a response is received
* Work with the QA Analyst and Pharmacists when there is a shipping issue to determine if the order needs to be reshipped
* Work with the Pharmacists when there is an out-of-stock condition and contact the patient or doctor as needed
* Work with the patient to obtain any outstanding account balance
* Complete patient updates as needed (e.g., new address, alternate address, credit card or insurance coverage change)
* Proactively work with the patients at year-end to see if there will be any new coverage/insurance changes in the new year
* Enter test claims for new potential patients to determine their copays
* Update patient notes as needed

Regulatory, Privacy and Other

* Remains active and in good standing with all licensing requirements of the governing states board of pharmacy
* Ensures that all HIPAA regulations regarding patient privacy are followed
* Participate in the company policy for recycling
* Set and complete tasks related to follow-ups in Rx2 to ensure the above work is completed in a timely manner
* Review existing SOPs and Policy and Procedures and enhance/update as needed
* Identify issues/topics that require a new policy or procedure - and share with management

All functions or duties of the registered pharmacy technicians shall be performed under the direct supervision of the pharmacists on duty. The pharmacists on duty will be working in close proximity with the registered pharmacy technicians to ensure adequate control or supervision and shall verify and document registered pharmacy technician work.

**Note: All staff may be cross trained in another related pharmacy jobs.**

Compensation

- Base salary $22 to $23/hour

- Bonus (based on performance)

- Stock options (based on performance)

- Health benefits

- Opportunities for advancement

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $23.00 - $24.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee stock ownership plan
* Health insurance
* Opportunities for advancement
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Physical Setting:

* Office

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* retail pharmacy: 2 years (Required)
* Pharmacy technician: 2 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* NJ Registered Pharmacy Technician License (Required)
* Pharmacy Technician Certification CPhT (Required)

title: Associate Principal, Content Manager, Qualifications & Exams
description:
Manage the maintenance of test questions and content outlines for securities industry/client qualification examinations. Conduct content committee meetings and manage the performance and productivity of committee members. Assist in conducting job analysis studies
Essential Job Functions:* Exam management and item bank maintenance – Maintain and augment item banks for securities industry/client qualification examinations by, among other things, analyzing the performance of current and pretest test items, assessing the need for new items, using a content committee to draft, review and edit new and current items, properly entering new items into the item bank and appropriately editing items already in the item bank. Collaborate and/or consult with Measurement Services Unit (MSU) when appropriate.
* Committee management – Manage assigned qualification exam committee membership to ensure proper composition. Monitor the performance, productivity and attendance of committee members. During committee meetings, manage committee to complete the published agenda. Recruit new committee members when necessary and retire current committee members. Train committee members to understand the basics of writing, editing test items and general testing industry standards.
* Item development – Edit new items submitted by committee members and bank items to conform with FINRA/client style guide. During committee meetings, lead committee activities and conversations to ensure that items meet basic standards. Use standard item statistics to help guide analysis and decisions on whether to keep, edit or delete an item. Consult with MSU for guidance on statistic-related issues.
* Content outline maintenance and job analyses – Make updates to content outline as necessary and publish updated content outline on a timely basis. Assist with job analysis studies under the direction of more senior staff, as assigned.
* Securities and financial industry knowledge - On an ongoing basis, research, monitor and evaluate the effect of FINRA, SEC and other industry entity rule changes, new securities products and industry best practices on exam programs and make necessary changes to content outlines and bank items.
* Maintenance and enhancement of item bank system – Participate in the development of system requirements and conduct user acceptance testing for in-house developed item bank and authoring system.
* Management of inquiries regarding FINRA/client exams – Respond to exam-related inquiries from other FINRA staff, FINRA members, exam candidates and others. Provide prompt, appropriate and accurate response. Refer advanced questions/issues to a more senior analyst or manager when appropriate and necessary.
* Assist with special projects and support department initiatives as assigned by management.


Education/Experience Requirements:* Bachelor’s degree and three (3) years securities/financial industry and/or content development experience, or equivalent combination of education and/or work experience.
* Strong interpersonal skills with excellent communication skills (both oral and written) are essential to effectively manage relationships with a diverse group of stakeholders/constituents with varying (often conflicting) interests.
* Must be proficient with all standard office software.
* Ability to work independently and produce high quality work product that requires a great attention to detail.
* Quantitative skills are desirable.
* Ability to learn and use databases is desirable.
* Project management skills are desirable.


Working Conditions:* Work is performed in standard office environment.
* Some travel required (20%)

IL\\*: Minimum Salary $87,500, Maximum Salary $156,600  

Jersey City, NJ/NY, NY: Minimum Salary $95,400, Maximum Salary $170,900
MD/Washington, DC: Minimum Salary $91,500, Maximum Salary $163,700  

WA: Minimum Salary $79,500, Maximum Salary $163,700* Including positions performed outside the state but reporting to an office or manager in that state.


Candidates can expect salary offers that range from the minimum to the mid-point of the salary range. FINRA provides full pay ranges so that the candidate can consider their growth potential while at FINRA.
#LI-Hybrid
To be considered for this position, please submit an application. Applications are accepted on an ongoing basis.*The information provided above has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work of the position. It is not a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required.**Please note: If the “Apply Now” button on a job board posting does not take you directly to the FINRA Careers site, enter* *www.finra.org/careers* *into your browser to reach our site directly.*
FINRA strives to make our career site accessible to all users. If you need a disability-related accommodation for completing the application process, please contact FINRA's Employee Relations team at 240.386.4865 or by email at EmployeeRelations@finra.org. Please note that this process is exclusively for inquiries regarding application accommodations.
Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. FINRA provides comprehensive health, dental and vision insurance. Additional insurance includes basic life, accidental death and dismemberment, supplemental life, spouse/domestic partner and dependent life, and spouse/domestic partner and dependent accidental death and dismemberment, short- and long-term disability, long-term care, business travel accident, disability and legal. FINRA offers immediate participation and vesting in a 401(k) plan with company match and eligibility for participation in an additional FINRA-funded retirement contribution, tuition reimbursement and many other benefits.
Time Off and Paid Leave\\*
FINRA encourages its employees to focus on their health and wellness in many ways, including through a generous time-off program of 15 days of paid time off, 5 personal days and 9 sick days (all pro-rated in the first year). Additionally, we are proud to support our communities by providing two volunteer service days (based on full-time schedule). Other paid leave includes military leave, jury duty leave, bereavement leave, voting and election official leave for federal, state or local primary and general elections, care of a family member leave (available after 90 days of employment); and childbirth and parental leave (available after 90 days of employment). Full-time employees receive nine paid holidays.* Based on full-time schedule


Important Information
FINRA’s Code of Conduct imposes restrictions on employees’ investments and requires financial disclosures that are uniquely related to our role as a securities regulator. FINRA employees are required to disclose to FINRA all brokerage accounts that they maintain, and those in which they control trading or have a financial interest (including any trust account of which they are a trustee or beneficiary and all accounts of a spouse, domestic partner or minor child who lives with the employee) and to authorize their broker-dealers to provide FINRA with duplicate statements for all of those accounts. All of those accounts are subject to the Code’s investment and securities account restrictions, and new employees must comply with those investment restrictions—including disposing of any security issued by a company on FINRA’s Prohibited Company List or obtaining a written waiver from their Executive Vice President—by the date they begin employment with FINRA. Employees may only maintain securities accounts that must be disclosed to FINRA at one or more securities firms that provide an electronic feed (e-feed) of data to FINRA, and must move securities accounts from other securities firms to a firm that provides an e-feed within three months of beginning employment.  

As standard practice, employees must also execute FINRA’s Employee Confidentiality and Invention Assignment Agreement without qualification or modification and comply with the company’s policy on nepotism.
Search Firm Representatives
Please be advised that FINRA is not seeking assistance or accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms for this employment opportunity. Regardless of past practice, a valid written agreement and task order must be in place before any resumes are submitted to FINRA. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at FINRA without a valid written agreement and task order in place will be deemed the sole property of FINRA and no fee will be paid in the event that person is hired by FINRA.*FINRA is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer*

title: Part-Time Afternoon Assistant Teacher
description:
Welcome to ECYC Child Development Center!

ECYC is a NAEYC accredited center with a great reputation for 40+ years. We provide quality care for children ranging from Infants to Kindergarten.

We are seeking a Part Time Teacher Assistant to work an **afternoon shift (1-5:30pm or 3:30-5:30pm)**. Must be able to work with infant to kindergarten age children.

The right candidate will assist Primary Teachers with all aspects of the daily routines for that particular age group. Applicants must be flexible, able to follow directions, take initiative and have a dedication and passion for working with children.

**Some of the Things You'll Do Each Day:**

* Take initiative in classroom activities and duties
* Interact with children in various activities
* Prepare breakfast or afternoon snack
* Change diapers and feed infants (depending on program)
* Follow the Creative Curriculum lesson plans as directed
* Work collaboratively with classroom staff
* Follow direction and safety protocols
* Follow Developmentally Appropriate Practice

**To be qualified for this position you'll need:**

* High School Diploma or Higher
* to be flexible and comfortable working with different age groups and staff members
* some knowledge of child development across ages
* some experience working with children in a child care setting

**It would be great if you have:**

* 2 years or more experience working with children
* CDA or enrolled in CDA program

**Here's what our current employees have to say about ECYC:**

"Love this center! I have grown so much as a teacher and have learned so much from my coordinator and administration. They aren’t just focused on developing the children, but also the staff. They listen to, care and support the teachers, which is a breath of fresh air compared to other places I’ve worked. Great place!" - ECYC Employee

"The team genuinely cares about the growth of the staff and their management of the workload. I don't know any other workplace that hosts a monthly "Dine and Unwind" event that offers a safe space for teachers to express their challenges. We have bi-weekly program meetings and monthly class meetings to discuss curriculum, goal setting, and children's progress. There are monthly staff events to foster team building. Credit to everyone trying to make it work during challenging times in the field of Early Childhood!" - ECYC Employee

Does this sound like the right fit for you? Apply today! We look forward to meeting you.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $14.53 - $16.98 per hour

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Schedule:

* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* No weekends

Application Question(s):

* Are you 18 years of age or older?

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Childcare: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Front Desk Associate
description:
**Benefits:**  

* Bonus based on performance
* Employee discounts
* Free uniforms
* Opportunity for advancement
* Flexible schedule

  

Do you love fitness?  

Would you like to feel your impact on the lives of many?  

Can you see helping prospective members get started?  

Would you like to hear the "thank you" from the members' lives you impacted?  

The Member Experience Associate is responsible for the entire Member Experience, you will be the face of the club; you are the person a member sees when he or she first walks in. You will be the first person they talk with and you will create a welcoming feeling.  

You have to have limitless energy and be great at multi tasking. Do you have a positive and upbeat personality with great communication skills? Creating the member experience requires that you wear many hats. Do you thrive on being pulled in multiple directions... guiding prospects on the phone, making a Retro Smoothie for a member, and assisting our Retro members with an exceptional experience. Ideal candidates for the Member Experience Associate position will possess the following:  

* A deep-down passion for helping others.
* A positive upbeat personality.
* Effective ability to communicate with customers, coworkers and managers.
* The ability to multitask.
* Member experience-oriented.
* Punctual, responsible and detail oriented.
* CPR/AED training preferred.
* Prior experience in a retail or hospitality setting is helpful.

  

Responsibilities of the Front Desk include but not limited to:  

* **This position will require you to work an OPENING SHIFT (4:45 am start) minimum 2-3 days a week.**
* Greeting and checking in members as they come in.
* Resolving customer issues in an effective manner.
* Membership sales and retention.
* Following up with prospects.
* Selling in-store merchandise such as Retro Smoothies cooler drinks, pro shop items etc.
* Ensuring a safe and clean health club environment for members and staff.
* Opening and closing the facility if scheduled.
* Following company policies and procedures.

  

All Member Experience Associates are to wear company staff shirt along with either khaki pants or black athletic pants. Sneakers must be worn. No boots, heels or sandals. You must be well-groomed and neat.

title: Telehealth Mental Health Counselors (LCSW/LMHC/LMSW/MHC-LP)
description:
Nassau Psychology PC is a vibrant, established, well-run, group psychotherapy practice in Nassau County. We're looking for a licensed Clinical Psychologist, Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), Licensed Master Social Worker (LMSW), or Licensed Marriage Family Therapist (LMFT), Mental Health Counselor (MHC-LP) to join our team Remote or In Office!

We offer healing, hope and possibilities for adults, adolescents, children and couples through psychotherapy and psychoeducation that recognize the value, strengths, and resources of all we serve. We are seeking experienced mental health providers who demonstrate the heart and skills needed to help our valued clients and who want to be a part of a flourishing team. Nassau Psychology helps therapists focus on therapy by taking care of the business side of a clinical practice.

We provide supervision, referrals, marketing, full billing and scheduling services, administrative support, beautifully furnished office suites and a fun and cohesive team of therapists. The Position is fee for service with reimbursement for any late cancellations and no shows. *This opportunity is ideal for the highly skilled therapist who would like to work in a thriving group practice setting while enjoying a full-spectrum compensation package including competitive pay, medical, dental & vision benefits , 401k matching, paid sick leave, professional development funds - - without the work, headaches, or financial investment of running a business.*

As a group, we strive to provide psychotherapy that deepens our clients understanding of themselves and their relationships. To that end, we use psychodynamic, gestalt, and family systems theories to deepen our work. At the same time, we strive to provide quick symptom relief, integrating the use of CBT, mindfulness and other practices in our work as well. We regularly consult with each other on cases and benefit from different perspectives. There are opportunities for peer-consultation, case conference and didactics as well.

**We are currently seeking full-time and part-time licensed therapists for our Wantagh, Cedarhurst, Rockville Center, and Remote locations.**

Part Time 16+ client hours per week including 4 evenings, or 3 evenings and Sunday for those who wish to work on Sunday.

We are looking for therapists who can see diverse client populations and presenting issues. Experience working with couples is a plus, as well as experience working with children, but not a requirement. Ideal candidates possess the ability to conceptualize a case, understand underlying motivation and use a treatment model to drive treatment.

**Benefits for Licensed Therapists:**

* Bi-monthly automatic bank deposits based on all sessions provided during the previous 2 weeks - (no need to wait for protracted insurance reimbursement)
* All credentialing with insurance companies is done by the practice
* All new patients are on boarded by our New Patient Coordinators (all paperwork, forms etc. are completed by our staff) so you can focus on doing therapy
* We have a very steady referral stream of clients to easily fill your caseload
* All billing of insurance is handled on your behalf
* Feel at ease in well-appointed therapy rooms
* Weekly consultation group
* Opportunities to offer supervision
* Dedicated clinical support and group consultations
* Thriving and connected professional team with year-round social events, sharing each other's successes and milestones and professional growth opportunities

**Minimum Requirements for Licensed Therapists:**

* Master's degree and independent professional license in New York State (including Licensed Mental Health Counselor, Licensed Clinical Social Worker and Licensed Clinical Psychologist).
* Availability for afternoon / evening work is helpful. Weekend availability is a plus. Part-time or full-time work available.
* Currently, we are not considering applicants who are an Associate or Provisional level of license.
* Enrollment on insurance panels is welcomed, but not required.

**For more information about our practice, you can visit our website:**

www.nassaupsychology.org

To apply, please forward a cover letter of interest and resume to the email linked to this posting. You will then be emailed a list of questions - and your responses will help us determine the next steps in our process.

Nassau Psychology is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Labor and Employment Associate Attorney
description:
A boutique law firm passionate about delivering top-tier legal services tailored to the needs of early-stage and mid-market companies. Innovative Virtual Law Department™ is designed to offer affordable, high-quality legal support to businesses that lack an in-house legal team. Known for dedication to excellence and meticulous attention to detail, have earned a strong reputation in litigation and a broad range of complex corporate matters, including business formation, governance, multi-million-dollar acquisitions, and financing transactions. Committed to nurturing a collaborative and supportive work environment, providing a platform for our attorneys to excel and advance in their careers.

**Position Overview:**

Looking for a Labor and Employment Associate to join a dynamic team. In this role, you will work closely with clients, partners, and fellow attorneys, offering strategic counsel, drafting critical legal documents, and contributing to the successful execution of client transactions. You will also engage in a diverse array of complex commercial litigation, providing meaningful solutions to our clients’ legal challenges. If you have a passion for strategic thinking, negotiation, advocacy, and debate, this position offers a fulfilling opportunity. Additionally, entrepreneurial attorneys will find ample opportunities to expand their practice, backed by our dedicated business development team.

**Key Responsibilities:**

- Litigation Management: Oversee a variety of commercial litigation cases from inception to resolution, collaborating with senior partners to develop robust litigation strategies. Represent clients in conferences, hearings, trials, and arbitrations.

- Client Advisory: Offer legal advice and strategic direction on a wide range of corporate matters, including labor and employment, compliance, governance, and contract negotiation. Proactively mitigate client risks by ensuring adherence to relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards.

- Document Drafting: Draft and review essential legal documents, including contracts, agreements, and governance materials.

- Due Diligence and Research: Conduct thorough due diligence to identify legal risks and stay abreast of legal developments to support client needs effectively.

**Qualifications:**

- Juris Doctor (JD) from an accredited law school.

- Active bar membership in good standing in NJ, NY, or PA.

- 3 to 5+ years of litigation experience in both federal and state courts.

- Experience in employment and labor litigation strongly preferred.

- Exceptional analytical, research, and problem-solving abilities.

- Strong written and verbal communication skills.

- Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.

- Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality legal work.

- Excellent organizational and time management skills.

**What We Offer:**

- Competitive salary aligned with experience.

- Hybrid work environment - 3 days on, 2 days off

- Comprehensive health and Long-Term Disability insurance.

- Retirement savings plan (401(k)).

- Unlimited Vacation and PTO.

- Access to cutting-edge technology to manage clients, matters, and overall practice.

- Opportunities for professional growth, business development, and career advancement.

- A supportive and collaborative work environment.

**Equal Opportunity Employer:**

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all employees feel valued, respected, and empowered. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds, including but not limited to race, ethnicity, gender, age, sexual orientation, disability, religion, and veteran status.

title: Sewer Utility Technician Apprentice II
description:
The Township of East Brunswick is accepting applications for the regular, full-time position of Sewer Utility Apprentice II within the Water & Sewer Department. A successful candidate will be responsible for performing regular maintenance at the sewer pumping stations and visually inspecting equipment in accordance with the established procedures. This includes pumps, generators, compressors, valves, gauges, lines, wells, and bar screens. This position also requires routine maintenance tasks such as adding fuel, changing lubricants, greasing fittings, cleaning wet and dry wells, and other tasks as assigned. **Must be available for a standby schedule.**

**Knowledge, Abilities, & Skills:** Must be able to understand the township’s sewer collection system and the equipment, materials, and methods used in repairing and maintaining the pump stations; interpret distribution maps, site plans, and survey markers; and effectively communicate with the team. Will be required to identify, use, and operate common hand and power tools.

**Experience:** Minimum 1 year of related experience

**Education**: High school diploma or equivalent

**Licensing & Certification**: Must have a valid N.J. driver’s license and CDL license with proper endorsement or the ability to obtain within a one-year period. A N.J. state license for collection of wastewaters is a plus.

All applications must be submitted by **September 11th, 2024**.

The Township reserves the right to hire prior to the closing of the submission of applications.

**IT IS THE POLICY OF THE TOWNSHIP OF EAST BRUNSWICK TO PROVIDE EQUAL OPPORTUNITY IN ITS EMPLOYMENT ON THE BASIS OF MERIT AND FITNESS AND WITHOUT DISCRIMINATION BECAUSE OF RACE, RELIGION, COLOR, SEX, POLITICAL AFFILIATION, NATIONAL ORIGIN, PHYSICAL OR MENTAL DISABILITY, MARITAL STATUS, AGE OR MILITARY SERVICE. AS PER THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY, IF YOU BEGIN YOUR EMPLOYMENT ON SEPTEMBER 1, 2011 OR LATER, YOU MUST RESIDE IN NEW JERSEY. IF YOU DO NOT, YOU HAVE ONE YEAR AFTER THE DATE YOU ACCEPT EMPLOYMENT TO RELOCATE YOUR RESIDENCE TO NEW JERSEY. IF YOU DO NOT DO SO, YOU ARE SUBJECT TO REMOVAL FROM YOUR EMPLOYMENT.**

title: Product Marketing Engineer Intern
description:
**Company Description**  

Renesas is one of the top global semiconductor companies in the world. We strive to develop a safer, healthier, greener, and smarter world, and our goal is to make every endpoint intelligent by offering product solutions in the automotive, industrial, infrastructure and IoT markets. Our robust product portfolio includes world leading MCUs, SoCs, analog and power products, plus Winning Combination solutions that curate these complementary products. We are a key supplier to the world’s leading manufacturers of electronics you rely on every day; you may not see our products, but they are all around you.


Renesas employs roughly 21,000 people in more than 30 countries worldwide. As a global team, our employees actively embody the Renesas Culture, our guiding principles based on five key elements: Transparent, Agile, Global, Innovative, and Entrepreneurial. Renesas believes in, and has a commitment to, diversity and inclusion, with initiatives and a leadership team dedicated to its resources and values. At Renesas, we want to build a sustainable future where technology helps make our lives easier. Join us and build your future by being part of what’s next in electronics and the world.

 **Job Description**  

Our Systems & Solutions Team (SST) is looking for a talented Electrical Engineering/Computer Science student to join our team this Summer as a Product Marketing Engineer Intern. Our team works on Renesas’ Winning Combinations, Proof-of-Concept boards, Lab on the Cloud, and other embedded solutions to help accelerate customer’s design cycles. The successful candidate will work directly with the SST Global Marketing Team, and cross-functionally with our Business Development and architects during their internship. An intern working with the team can expect to learn how to drive solution-based marketing, engage engineering and sales team to bring a solution to the mass market, and how to work cross-functionally with global groups to achieve a common goal during their time with our team.


Primary Responsibilities:

* Develop marketing collateral for embedded solutions including – Solution 1-pagers, feature/benefit messaging, technical blogs, videos, training webinars, etc.
* Complete competitive analyses to identify strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities to improve our user experience
* Promote marketing collateral internally and on Renesas.com
* Support promotional activities including demos, hack-a-thons, or other initiatives to evangelize Renesas’ embedded solutions
* Focus on Hardware Solutions

 **Qualifications*** Electronics/Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent field of study
* Excellent organization, communication, and presentation skills
* Ability to work in cross-functional and global teams
* Passion for solving customer problems and self-drive to learn new skills

 **Additional Information**  

Renesas Electronics Corporation empowers a safer, smarter and more sustainable future where technology helps make our lives easier. The leading global provider of microcontrollers, Renesas combines our expertise in embedded processing, analog, power and connectivity to deliver complete semiconductor solutions. These Winning Combinations accelerate time to market for automotive, industrial, infrastructure and IoT applications, enabling billions of connected, intelligent devices that enhance the way people work and live. Learn more at renesas.com.  

  

Renesas’ mission, To Make Our Lives Easier, is underpinned by our company culture, TAGIE. TAGIE stands for Transparent, Agile, Global, Innovative and Entrepreneurial. Our goal is to embed this unique culture in everything we do to succeed as a company and create trust with our diverse colleagues, customers and stakeholders.  

  

Renesas Electronics is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, committed to celebrating diversity and fostering a work environment free of discrimination on the basis of sex, race, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, military status, veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law.

**Job Description & Requirements for Chiropractor:**

A well-established practice in **Garden City, NY**, is seeking an Associate Chiropractor to join their care family. Specializing in subluxation, this practice offers the opportunity to provide exceptional care in a thriving community. This position provides a competitive salary of **$90,000 to $100,000** plus a relocation bonus.

We are seeking a clinically skilled Chiropractor, with a passion for health and wellness, solid communication skills, and desire to make a difference in the lives of others. Excellent relationship-building skills are a must along with the ability to provide consistent high-quality care. You will be responsible for attracting and retaining practice members as well as providing excellent health and wellness education. This opportunity allows you to be part of an innovative healthcare model and establish an extensive client base as you provide top level care.

**Additional Opportunity Details for Chiropractor:**

* Competitive Salary
* PTO
* Malpractice Insurance Coverage
* Relocation Bonus

**Community Highlights**

Garden City, New York, is just 18 miles east of Midtown Manhattan and is one of Long Island’s most charming villages. Garden City is known for its tree-lined streets, beautiful Colonial and Tudor homes, and shopping. Its central location close to many of Long Island’s major highways with five train stops offers convenience for commuters and families. Garden City is a great place to live and is popular with families thanks to its excellent schools, low crime, and family-friendly amenities. It’s also one of the most affluent communities on Long Island. Residents enjoy food from around the world, amazing golfing and endless activities for the entire family.

**About Us**

We have a passion for the principles of chiropractic. Our team is purpose-driven and works to serve the Kingdom of God. It is our mission to provide patients with the best option possible when it comes to health and wellness, providing the best results possible. We focus on correcting the cause of the problem instead of merely treating the symptoms or masking the problem. We have a comprehensive approach to rebuild patient health and prevent disease.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $110,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Paid time off
* Relocation assistance

License/Certification:

* Chiropractic License (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Pastry Assistant
description:
**Malai Pastry Assistant**

* Malai is looking to hire a Pastry Assistant to help with ice cream production, ingredient preparation, baking and packaging. To be successful as a Pastry Assistant, you should exercise exceptional time management to ensure that all duties are completed in a timely manner. This role will also perform washing and cleaning duties that are required in the kitchen. Additionally, an outstanding Pastry Assistant should be able to comply with all food health and safety regulations. We are a small, team oriented kitchen, so must be able to work and communicate well with others.This job is perfect for someone who wants to be a part of a growing company/ team, is a self-starter, and can thrive in a fast-paced environment and loves ice cream! There is an ample opportunity to grow with the team.

* Follows and assists the Kitchen Manager, Assistant Kitchen Manager, and Kitchen Leads in all areas of production, including ice cream, desserts, and ingredient preparation.

title: Full Time Event Server
description:
*Convene is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and we believe that diverse teams are the best teams. We live our values of GRIT (Genuine, Relentless, Integrity & Teamwork) and strive to create an inclusive and equitable workplace where everyone can be their true selves, where we all show up for each other. In line with our goal to be 1% better every day, we are committed to listening, learning, growing and improving. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to join us on this journey.*

We’re seeking a Hospitality Service Technician to join our Operations team. The Hospitality Service Technician will report directly to the Service Manager/Supervisor.

**What You’ll Do:**

The Hospitality Service Technician will provide genuine anticipatory service to clients and participants in all aspects of hospitality and conference services. In this position, you will interact with our clients and ensure they have a great experience at Convene. You will work in partnership with the Culinary, Production, Technology teams to ensure we are exceeding the expectations of our clients. At all times, the Service Technician is expected to be attentive to our clients’ needs and make them feel welcomed, important, and relaxed. We need someone with excellent communication and interpersonal skills, as well as someone highly motivated and ready to work with others. Our employees carry our Core Values every day: Genuine, Relentless, Integrity, and Teamwork.

* Greet all clients with enthusiasm and friendliness
* Maintain a warm and friendly demeanor at all times
* Provide world-class service, in accordance with our Brand Standards
* Set up, replenish, maintain, and breakdown Food and Beverage stations
* Accommodate special client needs and last minute requests
* Develop relationships with clients
* Accurately answer client questions about culinary and our spaces in a friendly manner
* Read, understand, and execute Program Execution Orders
* Follow checklists and Standard Operating Procedures
* Set up and breakdown conference rooms and refreshing rooms as needed
* Perform facility maintenance
* Maintain safe, clean, organized, and well-stocked work areas
* Responsible for constant sanitation, organization, and proper food handling
* Have full knowledge of menus, recipes, and other pertinent information
* Perform opening, mid-shift, and closing duties in accordance with company standards
* Perform cleaning duties including: wiping down tables and chairs, cleaning glasses, washing dishes, polishing glass and silverware, making rollups
* Maintain a professional appearance at all times
* Maintain professional working relationships with team
* Follows all Company drink recipes and procedures
* Proficiently prepares blended and cold drinks provided by the cafe
* Full knowledge of coffee and tea menu
* Perform additional duties as assigned

**What We Look For:** 

* Minimum 2 years server experience
* 1 year of coffee experience a plus
* Basic knowledge of food and beverage
* Proven excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* Proven good organizational skills
* Must be highly motivated and ready to lead other team members
* Proficient in multitasking
* Food Hygiene or Food Handling Certificate preferred
* TIPS Certification preferred
* Flexible and long hours are sometimes required.
* Ability to move, carry, push, pull and place objects up to 25 pounds without assistance
* Ability to reach overhead and below the knees
* Ability to stand, sit, and walk for an extended period of time

**Compensation:**

**Who We Are:**

Convene is a global lifestyle hospitality company that designs and operates premium meeting, event, and flexible office spaces. It is the largest single provider of dedicated meeting and event venues in North America and the UK with a network of 39 locations across nine cities; Convene’s portfolio of brands includes etc.venues, Club 75, and the “by Convene” label for bespoke locations in partnership with other organizations. The company counts Ares, RXR Realty, and Hudson’s Bay Company among its investors, and has been named one of America’s 100 Most Promising Companies by *Forbes* and a Best Workplace by *Inc.* magazine, *Fortune* magazine, and *Built In*. title: Part-Time Morning Assistant Teacher
description:
Welcome to ECYC Child Development Center!

ECYC is a NAEYC accredited center with a great reputation for 40+ years. We provide quality care for children ranging from Infants to Kindergarten.

We are seeking a Part Time Assistant Teacher to work a **morning shift (8am-12pm)**. Must be able to work with infant to kindergarten age children.

The right candidate will assist Primary Teachers with all aspects of the daily routines for that particular age group. Applicants must be flexible, able to follow directions, take initiative and have a dedication and passion for working with children.

**Some of the Things You'll Do Each Day:**

* Take initiative in classroom activities and duties
* Interact with children in various activities
* Prepare breakfast or afternoon snack
* Change diapers and feed infants (depending on program)
* Follow the Creative Curriculum lesson plans as directed
* Work collaboratively with classroom staff
* Follow direction and safety protocols
* Follow Developmentally Appropriate Practice

**To be qualified for this position you'll need:**

* High School Diploma or Higher
* to be flexible and comfortable working with different age groups and staff members
* some knowledge of child development across ages
* some experience working with children in a child care setting

**It would be great if you have:**

* 2 years or more experience working with children
* CDA or enrolled in CDA program

**Here's what our current employees have to say about ECYC:**

"Love this center! I have grown so much as a teacher and have learned so much from my coordinator and administration. They aren’t just focused on developing the children, but also the staff. They listen to, care and support the teachers, which is a breath of fresh air compared to other places I’ve worked. Great place!" - ECYC Employee

"The team genuinely cares about the growth of the staff and their management of the workload. I don't know any other workplace that hosts a monthly "Dine and Unwind" event that offers a safe space for teachers to express their challenges. We have bi-weekly program meetings and monthly class meetings to discuss curriculum, goal setting, and children's progress. There are monthly staff events to foster team building. Credit to everyone trying to make it work during challenging times in the field of Early Childhood!" - ECYC Employee

Does this sound like the right fit for you? Apply today! We look forward to meeting you.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $15.13 - $17.45 per hour

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 4 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* No weekends

Application Question(s):

* Are you 18 years of age or older?
* Are you available to work 8am-12pm Monday through Friday?

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Childcare: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person
