title: Manager, Fragrance Evaluation
description:
At Revlon, we create beauty innovations for everyone that inspire confidence and ignite joy every day.



Breaking beauty boundaries is in our company’s DNA. Since its game-changing launch of the first opaque nail enamel in 1932 (and later, the first long-wear foundation), Revlon has provided consumers with high-quality product innovation, performance, and sophisticated glamour. Elizabeth Arden made waves as a woman-led beauty company in the 1920s. In 1931, Almay became the original hypoallergenic, fragrance-free beauty brand.



Today, Revlon resiliently continues its legacy as a leading global beauty company. Our diverse portfolio—which consists of some of the world’s most iconic brands and product offerings in color cosmetics, skin care, hair color & care, personal care, and fragrances—is sold around the world through prestige, professional, mass, and direct-to-consumer retail channels. These brands include Revlon, Revlon Professional, Elizabeth Arden, Almay, American Crew, CND, Cutex, Mitchum, Sinful Colors, Creme of Nature, Britney Spears, Christina Aguilera, John Varvatos, Juicy Couture, Ed Hardy and more.



We honor our heritage, embrace change, and applaud diversity. We champion our employees and celebrate our consumers.



We are Revlon, together, transforming beauty.


**Position Overview:**



The Manager of Fragrance Evaluation is responsible for fragrance development, project management, prioritization of projects, and maintenance of the fragrance library and anticipation of customer needs. Directs and assigns all fragrance development work and must have an olfactive understanding of current key account product lines and taste preferences. Candidate must be aware of fragrance and marketing trends to enable them to initiate new fragrance development with perfumers and /or to select fragrances from fragrance library.



The Manager works closely with marketing to organize corresponding marketing research and to complete presentations; working closely with sales team to have completed samples made up for submission to customer.


**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**


* Must have knowledge of competitive market by category and odor types.
* Must be familiar with fragrance philosophies of all major customers.
	+ Product lines
	+ Fragrance preferences of personnel
	+ Testing protocol – how to evaluate, how to test.
* Organize and maintain a library of all fragrances developed.
	+ Continually review existing fragrances to see if it is worth maintaining in the library.
* Review all international projects.
	+ Communicates feedback on submissions to affiliates.
* Receive and review all fragrances projects.
	+ Determine appropriateness of existing library fragrances
	+ Work with perfumers to set fragrance direction and help develop fragrance according to customer and market standards.

**Knowledge & Skills Required:**

* 5 years direct work experience
* 2-4 years’ experience with Fragrance House as an Evaluator essential
* Strong people skills, including written and oral communication.
* Strong organizational, project management skills; ability to create structure and systems.
* Customer Presentation Skills
* Strong Computer Proficiency (Microsoft Office, Excel) Required
* Experience working independently and in team-oriented environments with management of complexity.
* Ability to conduct research into project related issues and products, coordinating this work with other departments.
* Ability to learn, understand, and apply new technologies and science-based research.


**Minimum Education Required:**


* Bachelor of Science Degree
* Master of Science majoring in Fragrance and Cosmetics preferred.


#LI-SB1



The base pay range for this position in New York City is $105,000 - 130,000/year; however base pay offered may vary depending on skills, experience, job-related knowledge, and location. Certain positions may also be eligible for short and/or long-term incentives as part of total compensation.



Employees (and their families) are eligible for medical, dental, and vision benefits. Employees are covered by the company-paid basic life insurance policy. Other benefits offered to employees include but are not limited to the following: long-term disability, supplemental life insurances, flexible spending accounts, critical illness insurance, group legal, identity theft protection, etc. Employees are also able to enroll in our 401k Retirement Savings Plan.



Employees are also enrolled in our company-paid short-term disability insurance (the benefit commences upon hire and allows for a portion of base salary for up to 26 weeks if you are disabled).



Employees will also receive 3 weeks of vacation, pro-rated based on date of hire for the 1st year of employment and twelve paid holidays throughout the calendar year.



This role is eligible for an annual bonus based on company performance.

title: In-Home Sales - 1099 Contract - Walk In Tubs & Showers
description:
In-Home Sales, One-Call Closing

* Walk-In Tubs
* Walk-In Showers
* Plentiful Media-Driven Sales Leads

Welcome to a one-call closer’s dream, where our team of Direct Seller Contractors not only enjoy a steady flow of pre-set, confirmed sales appointments, but also have the unique opportunity of selling a need-based product that help improve people’s lives.

Welcome to Safe Step, the #1 selling Walk-In Tub on the planet. See our ads all over the internet, in magazines and on television in North America. We our flush with top quality leads and looking for closers to make $150,000 to $250,000 per year running leads in your local market.

We have job openings for seasoned professionals who understand the mantra “the system reigns supreme” and those with the right skills who want to learn the system from scratch and step immediately into a 6-figure income.

**Are you in the top 10% of closers at your current company and looking for a change in industry?**

* **Our average performers sell eight jobs a month and earn over 100K annual income. Are you a average or above average seller?**

**Have your leads dried up during the pandemic or has your company scaled back?**

* **We have grown exponentially since March, 2020**

Can you close deals but are looking for a change in environment?

* Our culture is about people, teamwork and unity. We're not just selling a bathroom remodel, we are profoundly improving the lives of our customers.

**Job Description:**

Travel within your local market area, running confirmed leads at an average pace of two leads per day. Use a proven selling system to present the company’s product, company story, and service. Write contracts in one meeting, ranging from $12,000 to $24,000 per sale at a 10-13% commission per sale.

**Compensation Plan:**

You can earn $150,000 to $250,000+ annually. Our average direct sellers close 2 to 4 jobs per week, while our top performers close over 50% of leads and write as many as 5-8 sales a week.

Quarterly and Yearly Bonus Incentives!

**We Provide:**

· Cutting-edge marketing materials to share with customers at your appointments and use of our environmentally-friendly paperwork tools.

· Be a part of one-on-one professional management with limited meetings that are positive and to the point.

· High-level administrative staff will support you and a state of the art contact center handling your logistics.

· LEADS !!!! : Confirmed pre-set appointments every day of the week through major print advertising, TV, direct response mail, and plentiful Internet marketing.

· Sell a world-renowned brand-name product, Safe Step, built in America with a lifetime warranty.

· A product sold in the home to the demographic with the greatest wealth in North America.

**Prerequisites You Need:**

· Excellent in-person communication skills

· Highly driven to reach and surpass personal sales goals

· Positive attitude, personable and open-minded

· Strong work ethic and self-motivated

· Valid Driver’s License and reliable, late model car

We are currently looking to add driven and passionate individuals to our growing team of empowered leaders. We will be looking at candidates from various backgrounds, and while we prefer individuals with direct sales experience, we will train the right candidates for this great opportunity. Previous experience in sales, direct sales, one-sit sales, long cycle sales, or fully- commission selling is a plus! Previous in-home sales or step selling experience is also a plus.

In-Home Sales experience is a requirement. We have many reps that came from the Window, HVAC, Water Treatment, Bath, Kitchen and other various Home Improvement sales companies that THRIVE here due to the high-quality leads and flexible schedule.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Safe Step is looking for Independent Sales Contractors to work with us as Direct Seller Contractor.

Safe Step is committed to providing our customers with the industry-leading safety, comfort, and independence they deserve. As the nation’s top walk-in tub and shower company, our products are made to the highest manufacturing standards, and our customer service is unmatched. We call it the Safe Step Difference.

Compensation:

$ : Weekly Commissions

Direct Sellers that work with Safe Step will make an average of $150,000-$250,000(Per Year) with the potential to earn more.

As a 1099 Independent Sales Contractor, a work week would consist of in-home sales with one-call closing.

The direct seller is responsible for accurately and professionally communicating to customers all products available and recommending selections that would best meet the customer's needs per Safe Step recommendations to meet customer satisfaction.

A typical day for a Safe Step direct seller includes:

· Travel within your local market area

· Running confirmed leads at an average pace of two leads per day.

· Use a proven selling system to present the company’s product, company story, and service.

· Maintain a pleasant and professional attitude when dealing with customers.

· Respect customers' property and leave the work area clean.

· Observing good grooming and hygiene rules.

· Accurately complete and submit all necessary paperwork.

· Use of our proven “Step-Selling” system that gets results in the home. Cloud-based ride-along leads with a sales trainer.

· Use of marketing materials to share with customers at your appointments.

Must have:

· Excellent in-person communication skills

· Highly driven to reach and surpass personal sales goals.

· Positive attitude, personable and open-minded

· Strong work ethic and self-motivated

· Valid Driver’s License

· Reliable transportation

· Previous in-home sales or step-selling experience is also a plus.

· Experience installing walk-in tubs or showers is a plus.

title: Fall 2024 Internship - Supply Chain Operations
description:
**Every Fall Internship Should Feel This Good!**



We’re on the lookout for highly motivated college students, in good academic standing, who are passionate about our brand and working toward a career in the retail industry. Interns will be responsible for assisting in day-to-day operations within their designated department, providing support to other departments as needed, as well as handling administrative tasks throughout the office.


**You Will:**


* Focus on all modes of transportation (Ocean, Air, LTL, FTL, parcel, etc.) to develop optimal transportation solutions and best practices, as well as creating full visibility with milestone reporting, from ex-factory through delivery.
* Maintain freight visibility & metrics; KPI’s, reports & analysis, and processes.
* Focus on helping to maintain and improve our global transportation strategy in order to obtain short and long-range performance objectives.
* Work on ad hoc assignments throughout the semester

**What you bring:**


* Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree
* An interest in Supply Chain
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel
* Great communication, teamwork, and problem solving skills


**Every-day should feel this good because:**


* We have a fun-entrepreneurial culture filled with truly “good” people
* We offer flexible scheduling and are happy to work around your class schedule
* On occasional Thursday’s we have Bagels and Big Ideas where you can learn something new from executive leaders
* We offer a generous employee discount so you can rep our lifestyle on-and-off the boat


**A few things you should know:**


* This internship is for credit only and you must be able to provide the appropriate paperwork from your school in order to be considered
* Able to come into the office on either Tuesday, Wednesday and/or Thursday (2x a week)
* We work with your class and extracurricular schedule to determine your internship schedule. Please note: we recommend working two full 8 hour days and one 4 hour half day
* The Fall internship can be up to 15 weeks long with a max of 20 hours per week
* Fall internship slated to start the week of September 23, 2024
* With a growing number of applicants each year, this is a highly competitive Internship program. Please feel free to add additional information to your application such as a link to your blog, LinkedIn, your portfolio, or any other relevant project to show your passion!
company_description: We’re so lucky to be able to do what we love—we have fun, work hard, and meet great people.

title: Project Surveyor
description:
Overview:

Colliers Engineering & Design is seeking a Project Surveyor to join our Melville, NY office!  

Colliers Engineering & Design’s survey professionals have the expertise to achieve highly accurate results while maintaining quality control over data collected, from field to office, and precision of the final client deliverables. Whether the project calls for administering conventional surveying methods, cutting-edge geospatial scanning techniques or a combination of both, our professionally licensed land surveyors, highly-trained office technicians and field crews work seamlessly together to provide the most responsive and consistent professional survey services available. Implementing the right approach for each project is what makes the difference and ensures our clients they are receiving the most accurate surveying and measurement services.
Responsibilities:
* Analyze and prepare complete boundary survey by compiling record data and providing sound analysis and reason for accurate property line location.
* Perform Quality Control review on reports, plans, specifications, cost estimates, and other contract documents prepared by others for accuracy and completeness.
* Provide accurate computation for the layout of subdivisions, roads and lots as well as buildings and utilities.
* Provide assistance to staff in the preparation of reports/findings, plans, and other contract documents.
* Organize and coordinate the work of field and office staff required to complete design, field and/or other tasks on more complex projects.
* Assist in the preparation of project/task work plans.
* Provide direction to staff to complete project objectives.
* Monitor the work efforts of assigned staff including sub-consultants and/or contractors.
* May supervise assignments given to the Survey Technician(s).


Qualifications:
* Associate degree preferred, or equivalent technical experience.
* 5+ years of related experience.
* Advanced proficiency in Civil 3D, TBC (Trimble Business Center).
* Proficient with various data techniques and coding systems.
* Advanced knowledge of various surveying instruments, techniques, and computations.
* Advanced understanding of angular and linear measurement systems.
* Advanced knowledge of trigonometry and geometry.
* Ability to read, write and understand English for purposes of comprehending written job-related communications and verbal instructions and interactions.


Compensation: $36.25-$47.50/HR DOQ.
What We Offer:

At Colliers Engineering & Design, our people are our most important resource. That’s why we are committed to providing all our employees with a safe, comfortable work environment, potential for career advancement, and the ability to impact society through their projects as well as Company sponsored activities.  

This dedication begins with supporting a work life balance through a generous compensation package that includes: company paid medical, dental, and vision coverage; paid pregnancy disability leave; short- and long-term disability insurance; life insurance; a company-matched 401(k)/Roth; paid time off that includes parental and military leave; employee referral and professional license bonuses and a straight time policy that compensates exempt employees for billable hours worked in excess of 40 billable hours within a work week.  

We have also created an internal culture that provides the resources and technology needed to encourage personal and professional growth opportunities through reimbursement for education; a free in-house resource for hundreds of educational and self-enrichment courses; mentorship program; wellness program; Women’s Organization and ongoing philanthropic opportunities.  

Apply today to learn how you can join our team of professionals, so we can help you ***Accelerate Your Success***!
company_description: We maximize the potential of property and real assets to accelerate the success of our clients, our investors and our people.

description:

Collect data from the air, ground and subsurface to provide precision data interpretation with us, and accelerate YOUR success to become tomorrow’s industry leader.*
Responsibilities:

Manage, direct, and supervise the work efforts of assigned staff and coordinate the technical and managerial direction provided by Management regarding scope, schedule, quality and budget of projects.* Prepare effective work plans and man-hour budgets for approval by Department Manager.

title: Mental Health Counselors
description:
Nassau Psychology PC is a vibrant, established, well-run, group psychotherapy practice in Nassau County. We're looking for a licensed Clinical Psychologist, Licensed Mental Health Counselor (LMHC), Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), or Licensed Marriage Family Therapist (LMFT) to join our team!

We offer healing, hope and possibilities for adults, adolescents, children and couples through psychotherapy and psychoeducation that recognize the value, strengths, and resources of all we serve. We are seeking experienced mental health providers who demonstrate the heart and skills needed to help our valued clients and who want to be a part of a flourishing team. Nassau Psychology helps therapists focus on therapy by taking care of the business side of a clinical practice.

We provide supervision, referrals, marketing, full billing and scheduling services, administrative support, beautifully furnished office suites and a fun and cohesive team of therapists. The Position is fee for service with reimbursement for any late cancellations and no shows. *This opportunity is ideal for the highly skilled therapist who would like to work in a thriving group practice setting while enjoying a full-spectrum compensation package including competitive pay, medical, dental & vision benefits , 401k matching, paid sick leave, professional development funds - - without the work, headaches, or financial investment of running a business.*

As a group, we strive to provide psychotherapy that deepens our clients understanding of themselves and their relationships. To that end, we use psychodynamic, gestalt, and family systems theories to deepen our work. At the same time, we strive to provide quick symptom relief, integrating the use of CBT, mindfulness and other practices in our work as well. We regularly consult with each other on cases and benefit from different perspectives. There are opportunities for peer-consultation, case conference and didactics as well.

**We are currently seeking full-time and part-time licensed therapists for our Wantagh, Cedarhurst, and Rockville Center locations.**

Full-time is considered to be 38 client hours per week including 3 evenings, or 2 evenings and Sunday for those who wish to work on Sunday.

Part-time work is considered to be a minimum of 20 hours per week including 2 evenings.

We are looking for therapists who can see diverse client populations and presenting issues. Experience working with couples is a plus, as well as experience working with children, but not a requirement. Ideal candidates possess the ability to conceptualize a case, understand underlying motivation and use a treatment model to drive treatment.

**Benefits for Licensed Therapists:**

* Medical, dental, and vision benefits for full-time staff
* Reimbursement funds for professional development training / CEU
* Paid Family Leave
* All employment taxes processed by Nassau Psychology
* Workers Comp & State Unemployment insurance provided
* Bi-monthly automatic bank deposits based on all sessions provided during the previous 2 weeks - (no need to wait for protracted insurance reimbursement)
* All credentialing with insurance companies is done by the practice
* All new patients are on boarded by our New Patient Coordinators (all paperwork, forms etc. are completed by our staff) so you can focus on doing therapy
* We have a very steady referral stream of clients to easily fill your caseload
* All billing of insurance is handled on your behalf
* Feel at ease in well-appointed therapy rooms
* Weekly consultation group
* Opportunities to offer supervision
* Dedicated clinical support and group consultations
* Thriving and connected professional team with year-round social events, sharing each other's successes and milestones and professional growth opportunities

**Minimum Requirements for Licensed Therapists:**

* Master's degree and independent professional license in New York State (including Licensed Mental Health Counselor, Licensed Clinical Social Worker and Licensed Clinical Psychologist).
* Availability for afternoon / evening work is helpful. Weekend availability is a plus. Part-time or full-time work available.
* Currently, we are not considering applicants who are an Associate or Provisional level of license.
* Enrollment on insurance panels is welcomed, but not required.

**For more information about our practice, you can visit our website:**

www.nassaupsychology.org

To apply, please forward a cover letter of interest and resume to the email linked to this posting. You will then be emailed a list of questions - and your responses will help us determine the next steps in our process.

Nassau Psychology is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $32.50 - $52.50 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* What is the best email address to contact you?
* Which current license do you have?

- LCSW, LMHC, LMSW, MHC-LP?

* Do you have experience working with children?

title: Child Care Center Assistant Director- New Center!
description:
**This is a brand-new center anticipated to open in Fall 2024!**

**Ready to spread your wings and join our fabulous flock? Apply today and we’ll arrange a quick phone interview to get us connected!** 

Welcome to Peacock Learning Academy, where we believe in nurturing young minds and fostering a love for learning. As a premier, boutique educational institution dedicated to excellence, innovation and holistic development, Peacock Learning Academy stands at the forefront of shaping the next generation of leaders and thinkers. We are currently seeking a passionate and dynamic individual to join our team as a Center Director, someone committed to providing a supportive environment where every child can thrive academically, socially, and emotionally. If you're ready to inspire greatness and make a meaningful impact, join us at Peacock Learning Academy. ***We are hiring immediately!***

**What will you be doing?**

As a **Center Assistant Director**, you will work side-by-side with the owner, teachers, children, and families to provide a home away from home for children in our care. Responsibilities include:

* Nurturing hands-on presence in the classrooms, actively engaging with children, and playing an integral role in the learning experiences provided.
* Managing the overall operation of the center including boosting student enrollment by planning/organizing and hosting events, recruitment and development of staff, management of policies and procedures, child safety, environmental health/hygiene, and state licensing.
* Supervising and evaluating staff performance, including hiring, training, and disciplinary actions.
* Collaborating with the owner to provide ongoing feedback for teaching staff, using a variety of tools such as the Teacher Observation Tool and student assessment data.
* Implementing our curriculum to ensure children meet their age-appropriate milestones
* Working with teachers and staff to ensure children are progressing academically, socially and emotionally.
* Ensuring that all staff members understand the objectives and expectations within each classroom.
* Managing administrative tasks such as scheduling, processing payroll, accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general communication.
* Ensuring compliance with all state safety, fire, quality programming, educational and staffing regulations as required by NJSDCF licensing and accreditation.
* Ensuring the center meets state licensing and safety standards and be aware of any areas/standards that are lacking and develop methods for improvement.
* Implementing and ensuring completion of training for all staff members.
* Providing effective communication with parents/guardians about their child.
* Deeply connecting with students, colleagues and parents to vigorously uphold a culture of welcome, safety and respect and provide ideas for staff to do same.
* Creating professional development presentations tailored to each Center to address relevant weaknesses, if any.
* Assisting in other capacities that Owner, or designee, determines is necessary.

**Skills**:

* Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal skills
* Experience running early childhood program
* Proficient with Google Professional Suite Products (Gmail, Calendar, Sheets, Forms, Docs, Slides) and Microsoft Products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
* Ability to work independently keeping within deadlines
* Highly organized
* Great research and problem-solving skills

**Top Reasons to join Peacock Learning Academy:**

* Hands-on owner who is on site daily to provide staff support
* Paid time off
* Paid holidays
* Paid training and professional development to support professional growth
* Compensation: based on experience and credentials

**Requirements:**

* Master's Degree in Early Childhood Education/related field OR Bachelor's Degree in Early Childhood Education/related field with 1 year of child care supervisory experience
* 6 months Lead Teacher experience ***required***
* Must be able to function independently within the Microsoft Office suite of products
* Strong customer service and interpersonal skills
* Ability to multitask and remain organized
* Must meet state criteria for child care employment
* Must meet state criteria and NAEYC standards for Center Director approval

**Experience in one or all of the following is** ***highly preferred*****:**

* Brightwheel
* Bamboo HR
* Creative Curriculum

title: Registered Behavior Technician for ABA Therapy- RBT required
description:
**One of Fortune's Top Places to Work for Healthcare in 2023 and 5 years running!**

Constellation ABA is looking for caring, compassionate, mentor-minded aba therapists that want to teach individuals with developmental disabilities to thrive.

A Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) works with children on the autism spectrum to provide one-on-one Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) programming in the home-based setting.

**The peak hours for in-home ABA therapists are consistent Monday through Friday afternoons or early evenings for school-age clients, and occasionally weekends. There are extremely limited daytime hours available.**

**Each available position requires 10-30 hours per week depending on client needs and flexibility. Job location is within 20-50 minutes of posted location.**

WHAT DOES A REGISTERED BEHAVIOR TECHNICIAN DO?

* Implements one-on-one ABA programs developed by a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) in the client's home setting
* Collects and reports data for target behaviors to assigned BCBA supervisor
* Participates in behavior management programming for assigned clients
* Works with families and provides family training
* Participates in team building activities, meetings and ongoing training

WHAT IS REQUIRED?

* Have a bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university in a behavioral health field, behavior analysis or a related field, plus one year of full-time equivalent experience providing ASD treatment services.
* OR have an associate’s degree or an equivalent number of credit hours with a passing grade from an accredited college or university in a behavioral health field, behavior analysis or a related field, plus two years of full-time equivalent experience providing ASD treatment services. Such experience may occur at any time, including before, during or after receiving the associate’s degree or any combination thereof.
* Experience working with children (preferably children with autism
* Maintain a valid driver's license in applicable state and own viable transportation
* Travel to and from assigned client homes
* Active RBT Certification from BACB in good standing

NICE TO HAVE QUALIFICATIONS:

* Experience in the field of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)
* Bilingual

WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS?

* Highly competitive rates
* **401(k) plan with employer match**
* Flexible hours
* **Most holidays and weekends off**
* Continuing education
* **Supervision and support to complete RBT application and recertification annually**

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $23.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 20 per week

Benefits:

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

title: General Manager
description:
*Convene is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and we believe that diverse teams are the best teams. We live our values of GRIT (Genuine, Relentless, Integrity & Teamwork) and strive to create an inclusive and equitable workplace where everyone can be their true selves, where we all show up for each other. In line with our goal to be 1% better every day, we are committed to listening, learning, growing and improving. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives to join us on this journey.*

We're seeking a General Manager to join our Operations team. The General Manager will report directly to the Area Director of Operations.

**What You’ll Do:**

The General Manager oversees all aspects of the Convene location in accordance with Convene’s vision, mission and values including our core principles.

The General Manager is responsible for all aspects of the conference, workplace and/or amenity operations at the designated Convene location. The General Manager will direct, implement, and maintain the Service, AV/Technology, Event Operations, and Culinary philosophy which serves as a guide to respective staff to ensure 100% client satisfaction.

* Comply with Convene standards and protocols to deliver premium hospitality experience
* Effectively communicate via verbal and written correspondence with all level of employees and clients; exhibiting GRIT in all interactions
* Work dynamically and prioritize departmental functions to meet deadlines
* Approach all encounters with guests and employees in an attentive, friendly, courteous and service-oriented manner
* Oversee and coordinate the setup and execution of all functions with the Service, Production, Technology, Workplace and Culinary departments at either single locations or multi-unit complexed locations
* Coach, mentor and develop all level of employees at your location(s)
* Maximize efforts towards productivity by identifying problem areas and implementing solutions
* Responsible for overseeing the Property teams including hiring, staffing, scheduling, training, payroll, and conducting performance reviews in accordance with Convene standards
* Ensure and maintain the cleanliness and physical state of all conference, workplace and/or amenity spaces
* Attend and run meetings in accordance to Convene meeting cadence, running efficient and productive agendas. Oversee daily and weekly PEO meetings as well as weekly staff meetings
* Responsible for controlling and maintaining all service equipment, communicating with facilities management and outside vendors to ensure all equipment remains in working order.
* Create and maintain positive relationships with building management
* Work with sales manager and other conference planning manager to ensure accuracy of Salesforce
* Develop client relationships to ensure a successful event
* Oversee Production, Technology, and Workplace team and ensure proper planning, upselling, detailing, proper room blocks, and professional communication to clients
* Build relationships with all local competitors and surrounding businesses
* Work closely with Sales, Revenue, Finance and Corp Ops on monthly P&L review, monthly forecasting and during annual budget process
* Responsible for driving impactful financial decisions that positively impact the monthly P&L results and present out through Monthly, Quarterly, and Year End Operational Reporting
* Working cross functionally throughout the organization to create and execute strategic planning for the betterment of the operation
* Confirm that all payroll reports are accurate prior to approval and that all employees are compensated properly for their time

**What We Look For:** 

* Minimum 3 years’ experience in hospitality, including previous supervisory experience
* Ability to lead, develop other team members
* Ability to work effectively with clients
* Flexible and long hours sometimes required
* Ability to move, lift, carry, push, pull and place objects up to 25 pounds without assistance
* Ability to reach overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping
* Ability to stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time

**Compensation:**

Base Salary:

Salary Min: $100,000 Salary Max: $110,000

This role is also eligible for Convene's annual incentive performance bonus plan.

This information reflects the anticipated base salary range for this position based on current national data. Minimums and maximums may vary based on location. Individual pay is based on skills, experience and other relevant factors.

**Who We Are:**

Convene is a global lifestyle hospitality company that designs and operates premium meeting, event, and flexible office spaces. It is the largest single provider of dedicated meeting and event venues in the U.S. and U.K. with a network of 37 locations across nine cities; Convene’s portfolio of brands includes etc.venues, Club 75, and the “by Convene” label for bespoke locations in partnership with other organizations. With a combined 44 years of experience, Convene brands bring hospitality and lifestyle into traditional commercial real estate assets, partnering with the industry’s top landlords to deliver increased building value while also creating premium experiences for tenants. The company counts Ares and RXR Realty among its investors, and has been named one of America’s 100 Most Promising Companies by Forbes and a Best Workplace by Inc. magazine, Fortune magazine, and Built In. Learn more at https://convene.com/.

**We’re Here For You:**

At Convene, you’ll receive:

* Excellent health coverage for you and your family starting day one
* Medical and insurance navigation support through Eden Health
* Flexible vacation time plus time off for your birthday
* 401K plan with company matching
* Professional development support
* A chance to be part of a dynamic, growing team
* The opportunity to have a significant impact on your team and the business in the work that you do
* A culture of GRIT (Genuine, Relentless, Integrity and Teamwork)

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $100,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year

Work Location: In person
company_addresses:
Properties located in the following US cities: Boston, Chicago, Philadelphia, Washington, DC, New York City. 
International Property in London, UK. Opening in San Francisco, CA in 2023.

title: Community Outreach Worker
description:
**Explore Numerous Nearby Locations for Your Convenience!**  

**Schedule an Interview First - Apply Afterwards**  

**DISCOVER CAREERS, WELL LIVED.** Our mission at Sevita is to create a world where every person has the right to live well. As a Caregiver, you’ll provide assistance and strategies to the individuals we serve to help them live well in their community and environment. Each day, the connections you make and the compassion you bring make a difference in the lives of our participants. You’ll work alongside a dedicated team of clinical staff and supportive supervisors, while you grow your career.

  

**Program Services – Community Outreach Associate**
**Part-time (5-20 hrs/weekly)- $20/hr**  

Are you an outgoing “people person” who enjoys helping others? As Community Outreach Associate, you will work with individuals in the community to support community goals, recreational goals, and social environment activities, serving as an advocate for program participants to be fully integrated into community life.  

* Provide training, assistance, and/or supervision to individual(s) in the areas of daily living, personal care, financial management, community and social integration, medication administration, and/or job skills development
* Establish a therapeutic relationship with the individual receiving services to ensure effective guidance, support, and service delivery
* Work on behavioral assistance and family systems; work with family members of individuals in program
* Ensure objectives are met in accordance with the service plan
* Provide transportation for individual(s) receiving services to activities and appointments
* Maintain current progress and service notes; complete and submit required documentation to direct supervisor in accordance with applicable policies and deadlines
* Provide direct supervisor with verbal feedback and data relevant to individuals’ services, service plans, or administrative policy
* Meet with employers to develop potential work opportunities for individuals receiving services
* Attend training and other meetings as required
* Provide emergency coverage and/or care for individuals receiving services; report incidents of maltreatment, medical, and behavioral concerns in accordance with company policy
* Maintain confidentiality, respect human rights, and practice universal precautions in accordance with company standards

  


***Qualifications:***  

* High school diploma or equivalent required; Bachelor’s degree preferred
* Two years of experience in human services preferred
* All state-required training and certification completed in mandated timeframes
* Valid driver’s license in good standing with car registration and vehicle insurance
* Ability to maintain composure and exercise sound judgment and discretion
* Reliable, responsible, and caring nature
* Commitment to the company’s mission and values
* Exceptional communication skills with an ability to establish trust and rapport quickly
* A good listener with an ability to empathize while still providing guidance

  


***Why Join Us?***  

* Full compensation/benefits package for employees working 30+ hours/week
* 401(k) with company match
* Paid time off and holiday pay
* Complex work adding value to the organization’s mission alongside a great team of coworkers
* Enjoy job security with nationwide career development and advancement opportunities

  


**We have meaningful work for you – come join our team –** ***Apply Today!***  

Sevita is a leading provider of home and community-based specialized health care. We believe that everyone deserves to live a full, more independent life. We provide people with quality services and individualized supports that lead to growth and independence, regardless of the physical, intellectual, or behavioral challenges they face. We’ve made this our mission for more than 50 years. And today, our 40,000 team members continue to innovate and enhance care for the 50,000 individuals we serve.
  

  

*As an equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, citizenship, or any other characteristic protected by law.*
company_description: Sevita is a leading provider of home and community-based specialized health care, with 40,000 employees proudly serving over 50,000 individuals.

title: Line Service Technician - Full Time
description:
Why You’ll Love This Line Service Technician Job  

  

Did you ever want to work in aviation but didn’t know how to break into the industry? Would you like working in a fast-paced environment, often outdoors, around some of the most incredible professionals in aviation?  

If so, this Line Service Technician position with Atlantic Aviation at **HPN in White Plains, NY** may be perfect for you!  

  

In this position, you will provide aviation ground support services to customers in a positive and professional manner. You will perform in all facets of the ground handling operation including but not limited to aircraft fueling/defueling, baggage/cargo handling, aircraft towing, using marshalling signals for aircraft parking, providing lavatory/potable water service, and using other various ground support equipment to help support the needs of customer and their aircraft.  

  

Build a career in aviation you are excited about and apply for the Line Service Technician job today!  

  

Pay for this position starts at $21 / hour. This position with Atlantic Aviation requires availability for any/all shifts as well as overtime, weekends, holidays, and on call.### **Job Responsibilities**


Line Service Technician Responsibilities  

* Deliver and receive fuel to and from company tanks, vendor trucks, and aircraft.
* Operate all company ground support equipment as requested or required, including lavatory and water service carts, ground power unit, deice truck, etc.
* Perform ground marshalling using standard aviation signals.
* Perform customer service activities such as helping customers with aircraft scheduling and fueling.
* Assist with aircraft turning, loading, and unloading.
* Ensure all buildings and grounds are safe, clean, and organized.
* Conduct or assists with daily/weekly onsite safety inspections and audits of equipment and facility operations.

### **Required Skills and Qualifications**


Line Service Technician Qualifications* High school diploma or GED certificate
* 18 years of age
* A valid state driver’s license
* Be comfortable and physically able to work in an environment with frequent walking, stretching, bending, sitting, stooping, reaching, grasping, and climbing.
* Be physically able to perform heavy lifting on a regular basis up to 50 lbs.

**We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance testing.**
#airport #lineservice #White Plains

title: Aviation Front Desk Customer Service Representative - Full Time
description:

Did you ever want to work in aviation but didn’t know how to break into the industry? Would you like working in a fast-paced environment around some of the most incredible professionals in aviation? You will get the opportunity to interact with many large corporations’ flight departments and high-profile clients! Use your experience and outgoing personality to build a career in aviation you are excited about and apply for the Front Desk Customer Service Representative job today!  

  

Pay for this position starts at $20 / hour. This position requires availability for any/all shifts between 6am and 10pm including weekends, holidays, overtime, and on call as needed.### **Job Responsibilities**


Front Desk Customer Service Representative Responsibilities* Provide customers with professional service and assistance

title: Behavior Technician for ABA Therapy - RBT Training Offered
description:
One of Fortune's Top Places to Work for Healthcare in 2023 and 5 years running!

Constellation ABA is looking for caring, compassionate, mentor-minded behavior technicians that want to teach individuals with developmental disabilities to thrive.

A Behavior Technician works with children on the autism spectrum to provide one-on-one Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) programming in the home-based setting.

**The peak hours for in-home behavior technicians are consistent Monday through Friday afternoons or early evenings for school-age clients, and occasionally weekends. There are extremely limited daytime hours available.**

Each available position requires 10-30 hours per week depending on client needs and flexibility. Job location is within 20-60 minutes of posted location.

WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS?

* **Highly competitive rates**
* 401(k) plan with employer match
* **Flexible hours**
* Continuing education
* **Most holidays and weekends off**
* Supervision and support to complete RBT credential
* **FREE online Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) training**

WHAT IS REQUIRED?

* High school diploma (or equivalent)
* Experience working with children (preferably children with autism and/or special needs)
* Maintain a valid driver's license in applicable state and own viable transportation
* Travel to and from assigned client homes

WHAT DOES A BEHAVIOR TECHNICIAN DO?

* Implements one-on-one ABA programs developed by a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) in the client's home setting
* Collects and reports data for target behaviors to assigned BCBA supervisor
* Participates in behavior management programming for assigned clients
* Works with families and provides family training
* Participates in team building activities, meetings and ongoing training

NICE TO HAVE QUALIFICATIONS:

* Experience in the field of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)
* Registered Behavior Technician Certification (RBT)
* Bilingual

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $20.00 - $23.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 20 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Flexible schedule
* Professional development assistance
* Travel reimbursement

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Are you available to work Monday through Friday during/after school hours?

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Business Intelligence Consultant
description:
### **When you join Verizon**


Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together—lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you’re fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you’ll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.

**What you’ll be doing...**


Your mission will be to help us properly mine raw data and support key insight propagation that informs decision making across Verizon Business Group. You’ll be analyzing data and creating data visualizations that drive business action. Working across the company, you’ll use your analytical and visualization expertise to identify trends, issues, and opportunities, all with the goal of improving the customer experience and finding ways to make our business even better.


Responsibilities include:

* Supporting data analytics for the Digital and Customer Experience team, working to organize data and present it in a manner that is easily interpreted and can be actioned.
* Working with multiple sources of data and identifying the best way to connect data sets.
* Crafting results presentations and regular communications for senior management that provide key business insights.
* Customizing each presentation specific to audiences based on background and knowledge of data presented.
* Mining media, customer journey, and lead data to highlight performance and opportunities for improvement.
* Turning raw data into logical information for reporting, dashboarding, and visualization.

**What We’re Looking For…**


You are good with numbers and you love to dig into data to find the story. Crafting reports and spreadsheets is a fun afternoon for you. You appreciate design and have a keen eye for detail. You understand the importance of accuracy in data analytics and reporting. You are a self-starter and a multitasker who can work independently under tight timelines. You want to make an impact by providing the data that will help improve the experience of our customers. You are well spoken and can articulate findings to a wide variety of stakeholders. You are comfortable working in ambiguity and are open to the unique challenges of working in a fast paced B2B environment.

**You’ll need to have:**

* Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
* Four or more years of relevant work experience.
* Experience in an analytical/statistical focused position, ideally related to media, marketing and demand generation.
* Experience providing recommendations to stakeholders, partners, and business leadership within a matrixed organization.
* Data visualization experience, building visually appealing and compelling presentations.
* Experience with Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics.
* Experience with Excel, PowerPoint, Google Sheets, Google Slides.

**Even better if you have one or more of the following:**

* Advanced business degree.
* Demonstrated ability to define key business KPIs and establish performance measurement frameworks.
* Consulting, market research, or ad agency experience.
* Experience with SQL.
* Project management experience.
* Experience with Tableau, Thoughtspot, Salesforce, Invoca.


If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.

### **Where you’ll be working**


In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and a minimum eight assigned office days per month that will be set by your manager.### **Scheduled Weekly Hours**


40### **Equal Employment Opportunity**


We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees’ differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.


Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. From health and wellness benefits, short term incentives, 401(k) Savings Plan, stock incentive programs, paid time off, parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition assistance, plus other incentives, we’ve got you covered with our award-winning total rewards package. For part-timers, your coverage will vary as you may be eligible for some of these benefits depending on your individual circumstances.
If you are hired into a California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Maryland, Nevada, New York, Rhode Island, Washington or Washington, D.C. work location, the compensation range for this position is between $96,000.00 and $178,000.00 annually based on a full-time schedule. The salary will vary depending on your location and confirmed job-related skills and experience. This is an incentive based position with the potential to earn more. For part time roles, your compensation will be adjusted to reflect your hours.
company_description: Here, passion finds purpose and anyone who wants to make a difference can create impact. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.

title: Thurgood Marshall Conference- 2025 Verizon Finance Leadership Development Internship Program
description:
### **When you join Verizon**


Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. Candidates interested in opportunities that are not students of Thurgood Marshall College Fund Leadership Institute should search and apply to other roles here:****www.verizon.com/campus**

### **What you will be doing…**


Deliver the promise of the digital world. Moving the world forward takes more than the best technology, it takes the best people, with diverse backgrounds and perspectives. Transform how people, businesses and things connect with each other through innovative communications and technology solutions.

  

Verizon Finance serves as a key strategic business partner and enabler, bringing innovation to life. Jump in with your unique talents, curiosity and commitment to help solve challenges and make a difference.

  

This role is for a Finance Leadership Development Program Intern. During the summer you have an opportunity to:

* Leverage your skills to solve a business challenge with material impact by gaining knowledge of daily business operations to drive results.
* Demonstrate business and leadership skills through structured assignments
* Design and implement experiments/trials to discover new opportunities.
* End-to-end process creation and/or refinement.
* Manage projects while being challenged to generate smart solutions.
* Create and deliver executive readouts and presentations.
* Participate in networking activities, trainings/workshops, development initiatives and other enrichment events.

  

You must be currently enrolled in a degree program and be in good academic standing to be considered.

  

If you are interested in other roles and locations in addition to this one, please submit your applications to those postings as well in order to be considered.


What we are looking for…


You’re a motivated self-starter. Never satisfied with the status quo and always trying to beat a personal best. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where new challenges come up every day. You are flexible, dependable and work well in various environments. Learning quickly is personally rewarding and inspires you to take smart risks. You want to make an impact in your community and the world.

### **You’ll need to have:**

* Ability to participate in our hybrid 10-week internship that takes place from June 2, 2025- August 8, 2025
* **In attendance of the Thurgood Marshall College Fund Leadership Institute September Conference**
* Graduating between the dates of December 2026 and June 2027.
* Current enrollment in a Bachelor’s degree program in Accounting, Finance, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Economics, Business with IT/Computer Science, Statistics, Math or related major at an accredited college or university.
* Authorization to work in the U.S. without restrictions or need for future sponsorship.

  

Even better if you have one or more of the following:

* Leadership in school, project work, or extra-curricular activities or clubs.
* Strong analytical practice with data modeling and management, turning insights into strategic business outcomes.
* Effective communication/relationship management and presentation skills.
* Experience with Digital Tools, including but not limited to areas such as Robotics (RPA), Cognitive Computing (NLP/NLG), Analytics (Python,R, SAS), Visualization (Qlik, Looker) and/or Blockchain.
* Familiarity with and/or the ability to program in SQL.
* Strong analytical practice with data modeling and management, turning insights into strategic business outcomes.

  

If Verizon and this role sounds like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every “even better” qualification listed above.

### **Where you’ll be working**


In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and a minimum eight assigned office days per month that will be set by your manager.### **Scheduled Weekly Hours**


40### **Equal Employment Opportunity**


We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees’ differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where new challenges come up every day. You are flexible, dependable, and work well in varying environments. Learning quickly is personally rewarding and inspires you to take smart risks.


You’ll need to have:

* Ability to participate in our hybrid 10-week internship that takes place from June 2, 2025-August 8, 2025
* **In attendance of the Thurgood Marshall College Fund Leadership Institute September Conference**
* Graduating between the dates of December 2025 and June 2026.
* Current enrollment in a Bachelor’s degree program in Accounting, Finance, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Economics, Business with IT/Computer Science, Statistics, Math or related major at an accredited college or university.
* Authorization to work in the U.S. without restrictions or need for future sponsorship.


Even better if you have one or more of the following:

* Strong analytical practice with data modeling and management, turning insights into strategic business outcomes.
* Effective communication/relationship management and presentation skills.
* Knowledge of Digital Tools such as Robotics (RPA), Cognitive Computing (NLP/NLG), Analytics (Python, R, SAS), Visualization (Qlik, Looker) and/or Blockchain.
* Familiarity with and/or the ability to program in SQL.
* Strong analytical practice with data modeling and management, turning insights into strategic business outcomes.


If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.

### **Where you’ll be working**


In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and a minimum eight assigned office days per month that will be set by your manager.### **Scheduled Weekly Hours**


40### **Equal Employment Opportunity**


We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees’ differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.
company_description: Here, passion finds purpose and anyone who wants to make a difference can create impact. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.

title: Retail Sales Associate
description:
### **When you join Verizon**


Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together—lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you’re fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you’ll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.

### **What you’ll be doing...**


As a full-time Verizon Retail Sales Associate, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your career with a team focused on unlocking your full potential and sales success within one of our retail stores. Here's what you can expect:

* Generate retail sales by using your passion for cutting-edge technology, and exceptional customer service to expand the Verizon network.
* Learn and uncover customers' needs by creating connections and asking the right questions.
* Position product insights and solution recommendations to provide customers with a complete top-down sales solution.
* Close sales by using phenomenal communication skills to fulfill customer needs with simple and intuitive tech solutions.
* Continuously develop yourself through ongoing training and up-skill in operational functions across merchandising and inventory.
* Potential to grow your customer base by placing outbound calls and sending text messages to current Verizon customers who are interested in our products and services.
* Opportunities to engage with the community outside of the store to expand your loyal customer base, including at off-site Verizon sponsored events.


We’re hiring immediately and this isn't your average entry-level position! Whether you're early in your career or a seasoned sales professional, join today and earn from $49,000 to $59,000 a year, which includes base pay and target individual-based commission. Planning to go above and beyond? Our commission program allows unlimited opportunity which could allow top earners to make an extra $10,000 or more per year in addition to the compensation range quoted earlier. Compensation varies by geography and performance.


Our comprehensive benefits (starting day one) and perks are designed to help you move forward in your career and in your life outside of Verizon. From health and well-being benefits to investment in your education and career, we've got you covered!

* Best in class medical, dental, and vision
* Verizon 401(k) plan with matching contributions up to 6% of eligible participant contributions to the plan, qualified student loan repayments, or a combination of both (effective January 1, 2024)
* $2,500 stock grant per year, part of Verizon's Stock Together award program
* Sales recognition programs that have, in the past, awarded top performers with all inclusive travel to domestic and international destinations, gifts, and other incentives
* Five weeks of paid time off (vacation, holidays, personal days)
* 8 weeks of paid parental leave for eligible new parents (for new moms, when paired with short-term disability, this benefit provides up to 16 weeks of paid time-off)
* Up to $8K per year in tuition assistance
* Discounts up to 50% off on Verizon products and services
* Additional employee discounts on attractions, automotive, travel and more.


Too good to be true? Hear from our Verizon Retail Team Members on what it's like to be part of a team that invests in you. From our in-person new hire experience and award-winning training programs to our inclusive culture of learning and amazing benefits, you'll be able to apply your skills while elevating your career.

### **What we’re looking for...**


You’ll need to have:

* High school diploma or GED.
* One or more years of work experience.
* Willingness to work evenings, weekends, and holidays (you'll know your schedule four weeks in advance).
* Openness to pick up additional shifts and earn more income, typically during the summer months, November through December, and/or during peak vacation periods.


Even better if you have one or more of the following:

* Experience working in a commission-based environment.
* Demonstrated sales experience communicating with customers to find solutions.
* Customer service experience.


If Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet every “even better” qualification listed above.

### **After you apply…**


You may be required to take an assessment. It takes about 20 minutes to complete. If you’re selected to move forward, one of our recruiters will reach out to tell you more about the role and answer your questions.

### **Where you’ll be working**


In this worksite-based role, you'll work onsite at a defined location(s).### **Scheduled Weekly Hours**


40### **Equal Employment Opportunity**


We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees’ differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.


Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. From health and wellness benefits, short term incentives, 401(k) Savings Plan, stock incentive programs, paid time off, parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition assistance, plus other incentives, we’ve got you covered with our award-winning total rewards package. For part-timers, your coverage will vary as you may be eligible for some of these benefits depending on your individual circumstances.
If you are hired into a California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Maryland, Nevada, New York, Rhode Island, Washington or Washington, D.C. work location, the starting base pay rate for this position is $19.71/hour. This is a commission based position with the potential to earn more.

title: Social Services Assistant (Nutrition Technician Bi-Lingual)
description:
**Social Service Assistant - County of Bergen**

**Department of Human Services – Division of Disability Services**

Under direction, performs paraprofessional work involved in the operations of a social service program Meals-on-Wheels; gathers and records significant social, financial, and pertinent information about their clients and/or implements selected aspects of the program; does other related duties as required.

**Knowledge and Abilities:** 

· Interview clients and gather necessary program information.

· Conduct assessments and re-assessment to determine program eligibility.

· Coordinate meal services and deliveries.

· Maintain client data in database.

· Generate monthly reports.

· Provide case management and referrals to other social agencies in the community.

· Survey program participants on an annual basis to assess program satisfaction and effectiveness.

· Perform community outreach.

· Review and maintain program records and files.

· Contact and preserve cooperative relationships with other social agencies.

· Collaborate with social agencies to provide information and resources concerning nutrition.

· Maintain consistent communication with program participants.

· Assists in projects for the agency and gathers other routine data as needed.

· Responds to telephone inquiries regarding Meals-on-Wheels program in a timely manner and ensures information received is accurate.

· Fields incoming telephone calls from clients to suspend/resume service.

· Handles client comments and complaints calmly and politely; ensures that client issues are sufficiently resolved.

· Performs other tasks and duties as assigned by supervisor.

**Schedule:**

· Full-time

**Education Requirements:**

· Completion of at least 60 credits from an accredited college or university.

**Other Requirements:**

· Bilingual language skills a plus.

· Valid NJ Driver’s License.

· Experience and knowledge working with individuals with disabilities.

· Basic computer proficiency.

· Exemplary time management and organizational skills.

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Please send employment application to resume@co.bergen.nj.us – ***put in subject line job applying for, thank you.***

The County of Bergen is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer.

*It has been and will continue to be a fundamental policy of The County of Bergen not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, gender, gender identity, pregnancy, marital status, partnership status, domestic violence victim status, sexual orientation, age, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, veteran or military status, disability, medical condition, genetic information, caregiver status, unemployment status or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state and/or local laws.*

*This policy applies to all aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, demotion, compensation, training, working conditions, transfer, job assignments, benefits, layoff, and termination.*

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Associate (Required)

Experience:

* Dietician: 1 year (Required)

Language:

* Spanish (Required)
* English (Required)

Work Location: In person
