title: 2025 Rotational Management Program (RMP) Trainee
description:
**About Gap Inc.**
------------------


Our brands bridge the gaps we see in the world. Old Navy democratizes style to ensure everyone has access to quality fashion at every price point. Athleta unleashes the potential of every woman, regardless of body size, age or ethnicity. Banana Republic believes in sustainable luxury for all. And Gap inspires the world to bring individuality to modern, responsibly made essentials.


This simple idea—that we all deserve to belong, and on our own terms—is core to who we are as a company and how we make decisions. Our teamis made up of thousands of people across the globe who take risks, think big, and do good for our customers, communities, and the planet. Ready to learn fast, create with audacity and lead boldly? Join our team.

**About the Role**
------------------


Looking to jumpstart your business retail career? Are you curious about what makes a global retail business successful? Are you customer-curious and fascinated by trends in the ever-changing retail landscape? If so, the Rotational Management Program (RMP) is for you!
  

  

At Gap Inc., we believe that understanding all facets of retail – from concept and design to marketing and selling products, both in-store and online – is crucial for future leaders. Our interdisciplinary Rotational Management Program (RMP) is designed specifically for recent college graduates eager to seize opportunities and learn the retail business from the ground up, gaining an in-depth understanding of a global company.
  

  

Our highly competitive, fast-paced ten-month program offers rotations through Merchandising and Inventory Management, with additional immersions in design, digital, production, and store operations. This structure ensures you gain comprehensive, hands-on business experience while learning the ins and outs of Gap Inc.’s culture from brand leaders.
  

  

Participants are assigned special projects, allowing you to directly influence the business and interact with senior management. Throughout the program, you’ll embrace a culture of rapid learning and innovation, where problem solving and solution-driven thinking are highly valued.
  

  

Upon successful completion of the program, successful participants will be well-positioned for opportunities to work as an Assistant Merchandiser or Inventory Planning Analyst.
  

  

Come show us what you’re made of. We’re ready to meet you.
  

  

Salary Range: $73,000 - $75,000 USD

**What You'll Do**
------------------

* Learn to develop innovative product strategies and improve omni customer experience to drive business results
* Use rigorous logic and methods, strong analytical and critical thinking capabilities to solve problems and make recommendations to positively impact the business
* Deliver strong presentation, communication and negotiation skills to leaders at all levels of the organization
* Demonstrate leadership qualities such as a strong point of view and willingness to take calculated risks
* Prepare multiple projects with strong attention to detail
* Collaborate effectively with a broad and diverse group of business partners to achieve goals

**Who You Are**
---------------

* Recent Bachelor’s degree graduate or expected by June 2025.
* Passionate and motivated about working in the fashion and retail industry.
* A self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit, ready to manage your business in a fast-paced environment.
* Eager to learn quickly and adapt in complex situations.
* Accountable and able to see projects through to completion while rallying others to achieve success.
* Strong in listening, written, and oral communication skills.
* Possess an outstanding work ethic, organizational, and time management skills.
* Proficient in Microsoft Excel and able to learn technical applications proficiently.
* Past retail experience is preferred, but is not required.
* This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

*To be considered for this position, please upload your resume in PDF format when applying to this role. (Eg: LastName\\_FirstName Resume)*

*Use the same email address throughout our process - from applying to the role to taking the online assessment.*

**Benefits at Gap Inc.**
------------------------


* Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Old Navy, Gap, Banana Republic and Athleta, and 30% off at Outlet for all employees.
* One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.\\*
* Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.\\*
* Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.\\*
* Employee stock purchase plan.\\*
* Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.\\*
* See more of the benefits we offer.
* *For eligible employees*


Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. In 2022, we were recognized by Forbes as one of the World's Best Employers and one of the Best Employers for Diversity.  

  

Salary Range: $58,400 - $74,300 USD  

Employee pay will vary based on factors such as qualifications, experience, skill level, competencies and work location. We will meet minimum wage or minimum of the pay range (whichever is higher) based on city, county and state requirements.  

  

**US Candidates**  

Please note that effective, June 30, 2022, Gap Inc. will no longer require any of its employees to wear face masks or require proof of COVID vaccination, unless required by local or state/provincial mandates or as part of Gap Inc’s quarantine guidelines after being exposed to or testing positive for COVID. Therefore, please disregard any language in any job posting that refers to Gap Inc.’s face mask and proof of vaccination policy as said policy is no longer effective.
company_description: Gap Inc. is a leading global retailer offering clothing and accessories available for purchase worldwide through company-operated stores, franchise stores, and e-commerce sites.

title: PCC - General Offices
description:
Overview:
Our company is looking for a bright, motivated and talented Patient Care Coordinator. The Patient Care Coordinator is the primary point of contact and communication for patients in our offices. The Coordinator will greet patients, introduce them to the office, coordinate treatment services, and nurture the patient relationship. The Patient Care Coordinator must be a strong communicator with a passion for providing excellent customer service and strong aptitude for sales. The Patient Care Coordinators objective is to make patients feel welcome and comfortable and to provide the Ultimate Patient Experience to every patient that visits our offices.


**Job Responsibilities/Duties :**


* Set and achieve personal sales goals while supporting the goals of the team
* Greet patients in a timely, professional and engaging manner
* Introduce new patients to the office and staff
* Provide patient consultations and communicate information about recommended treatments
* Discuss cost of service, insurance coverage, and payment options with patients
* Build lasting relationships with patients by contacting them to follow up on visits to suggest new or alternative treatments
* Nurture the patient relationship to encourage patient retention
* Work as team player to ensure each customer receives the best service possible
* Supports strategic local marketing initiatives that help drive brand awareness and new patient growth

**Western Dental – Brident offers a competitive benefit package designed to enhance the lives of our Team Members. Team Members are eligible for benefits based on their full time status.**

* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Medical
* Dental
* Vision
* Continuing education and advancement opportunities
* 401 (k) plan

**With solid administrative and technology support and backed by outstanding management systems, our dental practices will provide excellent patient care and where our Team Members are appreciated and respected as professional colleagues.**


Qualifications:
* 2 years of sales, customer service or related work experience
* Bilingual Spanish-English skills preferred
* Ability to positively and proactively handle patient concerns and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to quickly learn new procedures and processes
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
* High level of ownership, accountability and initiative
* Friendly, outgoing and motivated personality

title: Patient Access Specialist I - HYBRID - PRIMARY CARE #Full Time
description:

The Patient Access Specialist I provides support to the Columbia West Campus sphere that is part of a system wide access center managing large volumes of inquiries and requests from patients and customers for access/assistance in scheduling diagnostic services, physician referral/appointments, and general information on ColumbiaDoctors. The Patient Access Specialist I is a key role in our patient experience ecosystem and serves at the heart of the contact center acting as the front door to patient care.


**Job Responsibilities:**


* Greets patients and answers telephone calls.
* Schedules appointment requests. Indicates special needs (e.g. special accommodation, interpreter, etc.)
* Communicates insurance participation, financial responsibility, and time of service policy to patient population.
* Obtain patients’ insurance and demographic information and ensure all obtained information is registered in EPIC.
* Performs real-time insurance verification and interprets responses.
* Collects pre-registration information to address outstanding Epic work queue accounts.
* Performs outbound calls to perform Epic referral scheduling.
* Contribute to the team by providing support and back-up coverage as needed and directed by Supervisor and/or Manager.
* General faxing, filing, and mail sorting.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.


**Job Qualifications:**


* High School Diploma or the equivalent required.
* Minimum of 2 years of relevant experience including proficiency in medical terminology.
* Bachelor’s Degree or college-level coursework is preferred.
* Prior high volume customer service experience in a call center environment is preferred.
* Bilingual (English/Spanish) a plus

title: Part-Time Registered Dietitian - Brooklyn, NY
description:
NutraCo is a company that provides Clinical Nutrition Services to Long Term Care facilities across the United States.


NutraCo has an exciting opportunity available for a motivated, goal-oriented Registered Dietitian located onsite near Brooklyn, NY. This position is a Part-Time(24hrs/wk) position with a competitive salary and benefits package being offered.


**Responsibilities Include:**


* Represent NutraCo’s focus on providing compassionate care, with respect and dignity to residents
* Address nutrition related health problems in your residents, such as malnutrition, undesirable weight loss, wound healing, chronic disease states, enteral nutrition therapy, parenteral nutrition therapy and other nutrition related diagnosis.
* Partner with other dietitians and facility staff to ensure optimal care for residents
* Complete Necessary Assessments(New Admission, Follow-Up, Quarterly and Annual assessments) Per Day
* Chart within the EMR system
* Attended Meetings (Interdisciplinary Team Meeting, Weight Meetings, Care Plan Meetings)
* Complete Daily Meal Round
* Complete a monthly Sanitation Audit
* Sign off on Dietary Menus
* Complete Section K of MDS
* Work with the Dietary Technician or Clinical Nutrition Manager to manage care of residents, if applicable

**Skills:**

* Be a Team player within the facility
* Strong and effective Communication with other disciplines
* Experience with an EMR (Preferred PCC, SigmaCare, Matrix or Visual)
* Able to work within a fast paced-highly regulated environment

**Requirements:**


* Must be a Registered Dietitian with the Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR) and provide annual verification or be Registration Eligible with a verification statement.
* Meet state licensure guidelines
* Meet Facility Vaccination Requirements
* Reliable Transportation
* Monday-Friday Schedule
* Previous LTC or Skilled Nursing Facility preferred but not required

**Why Work for NutraCo?**


* Competitive Salary with Benefits Package
* Room for development, growth, and upward mobility within the company
* Support and interact with other dietitians within our company network
* Work in a company where your work as a professional is valued and acknowledged
* Your voice is heard, and feedback is encouraged and supported.
* Multiple locations throughout the United States enables you to move with us should you need to relocate.
* Clear goals, directives and feedback in company expectations.
* NutraCo employs a diverse, multileveled team of Corporate and Regional Support Dietitians who offer growth in education, experience, and knowledge in the field of clinical nutrition for our valued team of dietitians.

**Benefits Offered: (apply to find out more)**


* 50.5 CEU Credits upon completion of your training program
* Life Insurance Options
* Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Options
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employee Discounts

**Salary:**


$30/hr-$37/hr DOE

title: Perinatal Sonographer #Full Time
description:
**Job Summary:**


The Perinatal Sonographer will work in a collaborative environment to provide superior patient care. As a member of the Division of Maternal-Fetal Medicine sonography team, the incumbent will perform all duties associated with acquisition, processing, submission for interpretation, and archiving of ultrasound images, and will be responsible for the care of the patient while in the ultrasound area. Successful candidates will have a solid foundation in sonography, strong interpersonal and communication skills, and an interest in furthering their sonography skillset in a Maternal-Fetal Medicine setting.


**Job Responsibilities:**


* Localize and recognize difference between health and pathological areas to check for factors such as position, obstructions or changes in shape.
* Integrate diagnostic sonogram with patients’ history, medical records and laboratory results, and adapt to examinations
* Present and prepare preliminary ultrasound findings to attending physician for final report
* Maintain log of ultrasound test findings.
* Present preliminary findings to physician for final report.
* Assist the physician with patient care.
* Collaboratively work with billing/ secretarial staff with regards to authorizations/charges.
* Provide coverage vacation/sick day coverage at other sites as needed.
* Other duties as assigned.


**Job Requirements:**


* High school education or GED equivalency required.
* Graduate of an accredited Diagnostic Medical Program.
* Candidate must be ARDMS certified or ARDMS registry eligible. ARDMS eligible graduates from CAAHEP (Commission on Accreditation of Allied Health Education) accredited program must be registered in OB/GYN within 18 months of employment. ARDMS credentials must be maintained yearly.
* OB/GYN experience for a minimum of one year.
* Ability to operate ultrasound equipment efficiently, evaluate sonogram to acquire diagnostic information, communicate diagnostic information to physicians, follow departmental protocols and guidelines, and communicate effectively with patients and health care team.
* Must be able to provide rotating coverage when required at practice sites located in Manhattan.


**Hourly Rate Ranges: $40.38 - $49.02**

title: Process Analyst - Data - Customer Operations
description:
**Requisition**: 78563


**PSEG Company:** Public Service Electric & Gas Co.

**Salary Range**: $ 88,400 - $ 140,000

**Incentive**: PIP 10%

**Work Location Category**: Hybrid

  

PSEG operates under a Flexible Work Model where flexible work is offered when job requirements allow. In support of this model, roles have been categorized into one of four work location categories: onsite roles, hybrid roles that are a blend of onsite and remote work, remote local roles that are primarily home-based but require some level of purpose-driven in-person interaction and living within a commutable distance, and remote non-local roles that can be effectively performed remotely with the ability to work in approved states.


We want you to be healthy, balanced, and feel secure. That’s why you’ll enjoy a comprehensive range of benefits, with a focus on supporting your whole health. Starting on day one of your employment, you’ll be offered several health-related benefits including medical, vision, dental, and well-being and behavioral health programs. We also offer 401(k) with company match, company paid life insurance, tuition reimbursement and a minimum of 18 days of paid time off per year.


PSEG offers a unique experience to our more than 12,000 employees – we provide the resources and opportunities for career development that come with being a Fortune 500 company, as well as the attention, camaraderie and care for one another you might typically associate with a small business. Our focus on combatting climate change through clean energy technology, our new net zero climate vision for 2030 and enhanced commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion; and supporting the communities we serve make this a particularly exciting time to join PSEG.


**Job Summary**
---------------


Customer Care Billing Operations is responsible for maintaining customer accounts and ensuring accurate and timely billing of PSE&G’s utility customers. The Billing Analyst team provides support to Billing Operations including all of Billing Operations sub-processes by forecasting workloads, tracking daily systems’ status and employee performance metrics, driving efficiency through process improvements, data analytics, initiatives, and IT Projects. The work is varied and fast-paced and interfaces across the Customer Care organization. The position, at times, requires travel between both Billing centers (Newark, NJ and Bordentown, NJ) and the successful candidate must be flexible with their work schedule.


**Job Responsibilities**
------------------------


The job responsibilities of this role can be broken into 3 categories: Analytics & Reporting, SOX & Business Controls, and Projects & Process Improvements.

 **Analytics & Reporting**  

Responsible for providing analytical support to business operations. This includes preparing and maintaining ad hoc, daily, month-end, quarter-end, and year-end operational and benchmarking reports. Reviewing, verifying, and maintaining existing reports and databases to prevent data inconsistencies and irregularities. Developing new reports and dashboards to support Billing Operations in achieving key performance metrics by analyzing and interpreting complex datasets. Presenting concise and understandable analytics to stakeholders. Identifying opportunities to automate and enhance existing processes while utilizing leadership skills and a strong understanding of the business strategies. Monitoring and maintaining SAP Business Workflow. Analyzing problems and developing solutions to client/customer concerns. Communicating with affected users to ensure knowledge transfer and compliance. Maintaining documentation of standard operating procedures and process documentation. Cross-training and mentoring peers. Gaining an understanding of process measures and benchmarking. Monitoring and maintaining EDI Billing and Interdepartmental accounts. Managing EDI vendor relationships and contracts.

 **SOX & Business Controls**  

Maintaining and applying a working knowledge of PSEG Standards for Business Controls and meeting management’s expectations for effective internal business controls. Understanding and performing routine Sarbanes Oxley controls. Cooperating with internal and external auditing. Performing reconciliation and reporting tasks affiliated with business controls.

 **Projects, Process Improvements, Initiatives**  

Playing a leadership role in the development, recommendation, and implementation of new procedures and process improvements. Supporting strategic initiatives and participating on cross-functional teams and process improvement initiatives. Collaborating to resolve issues, provide timely solutions, and develop or modify work process flows to achieve goals. Soliciting feedback from users to determine the effectiveness of implemented solutions and taking corrective action as required. Potentially leading projects or teams. Identifying business requirements and developing test scenarios for SAP system fixes and enhancements ensuring functional requirements are met. Conducting user acceptance testing, documenting test results, developing deployment operational and communication plans.

**Job Specific Qualifications**
-------------------------------

**Required:**

* Bachelor’s degree and 5+ years relevant business/analytics work experience. In lieu of a degree, 9 years relevant work experience.
* In-depth knowledge of the meter – to – cash process.
* Familiarity with the gas and electric utility industry regulatory environment, including PSE&G Gas & Electric Tariffs, and the NJ Administrative Code.
* Strong organizational, interpersonal, leadership and communication skills with ability to build and maintain effective partnerships within and across organizations.
* Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy, the ability to accumulate, organize, analyze, and interpret data accurately.
* Experience with creating data mapping and process workflow diagrams.
* Excellent written communication experience with summary data reporting, process documentation and end user training guides.
* Expertise in data visualization techniques.
* Strong knowledge of and experience with databases and data analytic programs such as Microsoft SQL, Access, Visual Basic, and Excel.
* Proficient in Microsoft Word, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook, and SharePoint.
* In-Depth understanding of SAP ISU Contract Billing, related data tables, and SAP Business Workflow.
* Experience in identifying project requirements and user stories. As well as experience with defining and validating user acceptance test cases pertaining to data fixes.

**Desired Qualifications:**

* Advanced SQL query skills and understanding of relational database principles.
* Proficient in designing SQL queries, views, and stored procedures to extract data from multiple sources and perform relevant analysis.
* Proficient with SAP, Microsoft Teams, Power BI, and M365
* Strong understanding of various SAP ISU modules, device management, Billing and Invoicing, FICA, CCS, Master Data, EDM, EMMA, BPEM, OLE and Winshuttle Scripting.
**Minimum Years of Experience**
-------------------------------


5 years of experience**Education**
-------------


Bachelor**Certifications**
------------------


None Noted**Disclaimer**
--------------

Under the law, the Company is limited in who it can share this information with and in certain circumstances it is necessary to obtain specific authorization before the Company can share this information. Accordingly, if the position does require access to this information, you must complete a 10 CFR Part 810 Export Control Compliance Nationality Request Form, a copy of which will be provided to you by Talent Acquisition if an offer is made. If there is a need for specific authorization, due to the time it takes to obtain authorization from the government, we will likely not be able to further proceed with an offer.

title: Medical Office Manager- Downtown Brooklyn
description:
**About Us**

**Metro Vein Centers is a fast-growing provider of vein and vascular treatments with 18+ locations nationwide. Our award-winning, #1 rated vein clinics are guided by the principle of providing exceptional customer service alongside industry-leading medical care.** 

**Position Summary**

**We are looking to hire Medical Office Manager to support our Medical Doctor and Staff. The Office Manager must have experience leading a high-volume, fast-passed medical practice while maintaining the highest standards of customer service.** 

**In this position, you will work collaboratively with the Medical doctor to manage day-to-day operations of all non-clinical aspects in the clinic, including managing a staff of Ultrasound Technologists, Medical Assistants, and Receptionists.** 

**Detailed Responsibilities**

* **Manage day to day clinic needs by developing schedules, leading the front desk, implementing productivity standards, resolving operation/facility problems, and implementing new procedures.**
* **Ensure exceptional customer service in all patient interactions and adherence to all policies and procedures. Coach team to ensure quality customer service and prompt and accurate completion of all required documentation.**
* **Manage patient satisfaction for the clinic and develop best practices to ensure efficient operations, and professional resolution of complaints or issues that arise.**
* **Monitors efficiency of reception activities (e.g., responsiveness to calls, attendance rates, and other performance KPIs). Utilizes analytcical reports to identify trends and recommend changes in strategy and business to improve performance.**
* **Optimize patient scheduling to meet the growth goals of the clinic while ensuring a smooth patient flow.**
* **Review and monitors all inventory within office, such as medical supplies, and office supplies.**
* **Performs all managerial duties such as staff training, evaluation of staff performance, along with hiring, promoting and terminating staff, as needed.**
* **Ensure efficient communication between the clinic, call center, billing department, and administarative team.**

**Skills & Qualifications**

* **1+ years of work experience in a medical office as a Supervisor or Manager**
* **Ability to lead by example and manage a team while contributing as a front-line worker**
* **Excellent interpersonal skills, problem-solving, and leadership skills**
* **Ability to remain calm in stressful situations and respond to patient complaints in a timely and professional manner.**
* **Professional communication and presentation skills, including face to face, email, telephone, and video conference.**
* **Experience leveraging analytics and reporting**
* **Fluent in spanish a plus, but not required**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Language:

* Spanish (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Clerical Assistant - T11 #121
description:
**Who We Are:**


St. John’s Episcopal Hospital is the only hospital providing emergency and ambulatory care to the densely populated, culturally and economically diverse, and medically underserved populations of the Rockaways and Five Towns in southern Queens County and southwestern Nassau County, New York. Celebrating over 110 years of community care, the 257-bed facility provides people of all faiths with comprehensive preventive, diagnostic treatment and rehabilitative services, regardless of ability to pay.


**Come Grow With Us!**

Greets all new admissions to the Care Center; orients patient/family to the Care Center. Ensure that patient has admission kit; follow-up on patient requests/needs, or directs requests/needs to the appropriate team member. Manage high volume of calls. Collaborates with the unit manager and care team members in providing a variety of essential clerical functions to the department.

title: Assistant Men's & Women's Track & Field Coach
description:
The Assistant Men’s and Women’s Track and Field Coach reports to the Head Coach. Responsibilities include: assisting with organizational duties and the development of training and practice schedules; teaching, evaluating and refining sport specific skill development for student-athletes; and recruitment of qualified student-athletes within university and NCAA guidelines.
Required Qualifications:
1. Bachelor’s Degree required.
2. Prior experience coaching Men’s and Women’s Track and Field at the collegiate or high school level and/or competitive personal playing experience.
3. Minimum of 2 years of Men’s and Women’s Track and Field coaching experience.
4. Knowledge of NCAA Division I rules and regulations a plus.
5. Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
6. Must have a First Aid and CPR certification or obtain them during the 90 day Introductory Period. National Red Cross Certification preferred.
7. Valid driver’s license and an acceptable driving record in accordance with the university’s Motor Vehicle policy. A MVC check will be required at the time of hire and thereafter as deemed appropriate by the university. Candidates for hire will be required to sign a waiver authorizing the MVC check.
8. Must be willing to travel and be available to work flexible hours including nights and weekends as required.

35

Required Qualifications:
High school degree or GED required. Bachelor’s degree preferred. 2. Strong administrative and operations management skills. 4. Ability to work effectively with a diverse population of students, faculty, staff, and administrators. 5. Willing and able to work non-standard hours as required, including evenings and weekends. 6. Personal computer literacy for word processing, spreadsheet, and data management. Knowledge of Microsoft Office preferred. Experience with Ellucian Colleague a plus. 7. Strong oral and written communication skills and the ability to interact effectively with students, staff, faculty, and external constituents. 8.
